About the job  Job Description  We are currently building our platform team and hiring for a full-time, in-person full-stack engineer with the ambition to help get things done. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to apply their skills towards fighting climate change, wants to experience the high-pace, high-ownership setting of an early startup, and can start onboarding in the next few weeks.     Climate change is one of the most meaningful challenges of our generation, and every possible solution put forward by the United Nations IPCC requires scaled carbon sequestration. Forests are critical for this reason, but they need to be managed for a growing set of values including sustainable wood production, carbon, biodiversity, and wildfire risk mitigation. We are an MIT climatetech startup applying autonomous vehicle technology to solve this problem, utilizing cutting edge sensors and perception AI to build the modern tooling needed to manage forests with great accuracy and confidence.     Job brief  We are looking for a full-stack software engineer who excels at designing and implementing complex software systems. Responsibilities can range from implementing data pipelines between our robotics algorithms and our platform, to working on our ipad app, to implementing the latest features foresters have asked for in our web app. This is an amazing opportunity to join a well-positioned, ambitious technology startup making a large impact fighting climate change.     To be successful in this role, you should have an open mind and be familiar with a wide variety of software technologies. If you like being a polyglot in the tech world, we would love to talk with you!        Responsibilities (may include)  Collaborate with stakeholders to define the scope and scale of software projects Design, implement, and integrate web and mobile applications, API endpoints, and databases Deploy containerized software to AWS Develop and maintain internal software tools Identify/fix performance and efficiency bottlenecks Write clear technical documentation        Requirements  2+ years proven experience with Typescript and React (you should be able to point to shipped work). If you have fewer than two years of full-time employment in Typescript/React, please justify how you have equivalent experience. Ability to learn new tools and frameworks quickly Team spirit; strong communication and collaboration skills Good time-management skills

About the job  We are looking for a Technical Co-Founder (Future CTO)  DianAI is building an AI system based on clinically structured trauma therapy protocols (EMDR & ImTT). The goal is to develop an AI that can apply real therapeutic steps in a standardized, safe, and measurable way ‚Äî not just chat or provide coping tips.     Role  You will lead the technical development and define the architecture of our LLM-based system. You will be part of the founding team with responsibility over product direction, model performance, and long-term scalability.     What you should bring  Hands-on experience setting up and fine-tuning LLMs (open-source or proprietary) Knowledge in RAG, embeddings, vector databases, multi-agent architectures Experience developing custom LLM pipelines or adapting foundation models Strong backend engineering skills (Python, PyTorch, HuggingFace, LangChain, APIs) Interest in building a proprietary therapeutic model from structured protocols Entrepreneurial mindset and willingness to take ownership  What we offer  Co-founder position with equity Opportunity to build a new category in mental health technology Collaboration with experts in psychology, AI, and health innovation Remote-first, flexible work setup  Objective  We are looking for someone who wants to build this from the ground up with us ‚Äî with a clear path to becoming CTO.  üì© Contact: diana@dianai.ai      üí¨ Or send me a message here on LinkedIn.

About the job  Join Our Team!  Railroad Construction Company, Inc. is seeking a motivated and detail-oriented professional to lead project teams in the New England area. If you‚Äôre passionate about construction, thrive in a fast-paced environment, and are ready to take the next step in your career, we want to hear from you!      This is an excellent opportunity to join our fast-growing company to manage challenging infrastructure projects from start to finish while working alongside an experienced and supportive team.     Responsibilities:  Champion safety by enforcing policies, developing HASPs, and ensuring OSHA/client compliance. Drive quality by implementing project programs and maintaining high standards. Act as the go-to communicator with owners, engineers, vendors, and subcontractors. Lead project meetings and support Superintendents with work plans and schedules. Manage budgets, change orders, and subcontractor agreements. Oversee procurement of materials and equipment. Track project performance through cost controls, financials, and CPM schedules (P6 or equivalent). Mentor and develop engineering staff to strengthen project teams.     Requirements:  Bachelor‚Äôs in Civil Engineering, Construction Management, or Environmental Engineering. 5‚Äì10+ years of heavy civil project management experience with projects $1M‚Äì$100M. Strong knowledge of heavy civil means/methods, crew composition, and production rates. Familiarity with CTDOT, MASSDOT, MBTA, MASSPORT, and/or AMTRAK specs. Proficient with Excel, Word, Bluebeam, HCSS, and scheduling software. Cost accounting experience preferred. Proven leadership with excellent communication and problem-solving skills. Willingness to travel within the Northeast region as project needs require.

About the job  About KPC Finance  KPC Finance is an international investment and venture capital firm specializing in innovation, blockchain, and emerging technologies.   Our mission is to empower the next generation of entrepreneurs and accelerate the adoption of Web3 through strategic investments, data-driven products, and ecosystem partnerships.  We‚Äôre expanding our product organization and seeking a Product Manager | Crypto & Web3 to lead the strategy, roadmap, and execution of digital products that power our blockchain ecosystem, trading platforms, and venture operations.  This is a fully remote role ‚Äî perfect for a strategic, hands-on product leader who thrives at the intersection of technology, finance, and decentralized innovation.     Role Overview  As a Product Manager, you will define and drive the roadmap for KPC Finance‚Äôs Web3 products ‚Äî from trading and analytics tools to blockchain-based venture platforms.   You‚Äôll collaborate closely with engineers, designers, and business stakeholders to bring new crypto-native solutions to market and enhance our users‚Äô experience across both retail and institutional layers.     Key Responsibilities Define and execute the product vision and roadmap for KPC Finance‚Äôs Web3 and crypto platforms. Translate complex blockchain concepts (DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, Layer-1/2) into intuitive user experiences. Collaborate with engineering and design teams to develop, test, and launch new product features. Conduct market research, user interviews, and competitor analysis to guide product strategy. Define and monitor key product KPIs, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Work with business development and marketing teams on go-to-market strategies and community growth. Identify strategic partnership opportunities with protocols, exchanges, and ecosystem players. Drive continuous product improvement through feedback loops and data-driven insights.     Qualifications 4‚Äì8 years of experience in product management within fintech, blockchain, or SaaS environments. Deep understanding of Web3 technologies, including smart contracts, DeFi, NFTs, DAOs, and tokenomics. Proven track record of building and scaling crypto or blockchain-based products. Strong analytical skills with experience in defining KPIs, A/B testing, and user research. Excellent stakeholder management, communication, and leadership abilities. Experience working with distributed engineering teams in an agile environment. Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Computer Science, or Engineering (MBA or similar advanced degree preferred).     What‚Äôs Offered  Compensation: $160,000 ‚Äì $190,000 annual base salary   Performance-based bonuses tied to product milestones and adoption metrics   Equity participation in select product and venture initiatives   Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance (U.S.)   Paid time off and unlimited personal days based on performance and accountability   100% remote work with flexible hours and global collaboration   Annual company offsites and attendance at major Web3 conferences   Professional development allowance for courses, certifications, and industry events     Why Join Us Shape the next generation of Web3 products and user experiences. Collaborate with a world-class global team of engineers, traders, and venture experts. Play a key role in bridging traditional finance and decentralized technologies. Join a company where innovation, autonomy, and impact truly matter.

Job Title: Staff Software Development Engineer - Front End with verification
Description: About the job  Job Title: Front-end Software Development Engineer  Location: Chicago, IL ( Preferred) / New York, NY  About Us: At Clearwater Analytics, we are on a mission to become the world's most trusted and comprehensive technology platform for investment management, reporting, accounting, and analytics. We partner with sophisticated institutional investors worldwide and are seeking a Front-end Software Development Engineer who shares our passion for innovation and client commitment.  Role Overview: We are looking for a highly skilled Front-end Software Development Engineer with over 15 years of total experience, including hands-on experience in Front Office architecture and coding. This role requires deep technical expertise in cloud technologies and distributed architecture, with a strong commitment to engineering and operational excellence.  Key Responsibilities:   Design and develop scalable, high-performance software solutions in a distributed architecture environment.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure that engineering strategies align with business objectives and customer needs.  Implement real-time and asynchronous systems with a focus on event-driven architecture.  Ensure operational excellence by adhering to best practices in software development and engineering.  Present technical concepts and project updates clearly to stakeholders, fostering effective communication.    Requirements:    15+ years of hands-on software engineering experience, with a focus on architecture and coding in the FinTech sector (strong Front Office experience preferred).  Deep expertise in cloud platforms (AWS/GCP/Azure) and distributed architectures.  Experience with real-time systems, event-driven architecture, and engineering excellence in a large-scale environment.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Front end:   Experience with React Native, Angular, or any other modern front-end framework (this is team specific)  Experience with typescript in an object-oriented or functional paradigm  Experience making reusable front end components  Experience using front-end specific testing libraries (Jest, cypress, etc)  Experience using front-end build processes (webpack, rollup, etc) Containerization and front-end infrastructure knowledge is a plus   Desired Qualifications:   Experience in both FinTech and BigTech environments, with a strong understanding of investment management at scale. What we offer:   Business casual atmosphere in a flexible working environment  Team-focused culture that promotes innovation and ownership  Access cutting-edge investment reporting technology and expertise  Defined and undefined career pathways, allowing you to grow your way  Competitive medical, dental, vision, and life insurance benefits  Maternity and paternity leave  Personal Time Off and Volunteer Time Off to give back to the community  RSUs, as well as an employee stock purchase plan and a 401 (k) with a match  Work from anywhere 3 weeks out of the year  Work from home Fridays    Why Join Us? Salary Range  $179,400.00 - $243,136.45  This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Job Title: Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer with verification
Description: About the job  Unable to partner with 3rd party vendors (Corp-to-Corp/C2C) for this opportunity. We are unable to sponsor at this time. Relocation assistance is not provided.      About the Role  We are seeking a Senior Fullstack JavaScript Developer with a strong growth mindset, a passion for learning, and a track record of thriving in enterprise environments. This role is perfect for a highly experienced engineer who is fluent in both frontend and backend development, adept at working asynchronously across global time zones, and comfortable navigating the trade-offs of Vibe Coding.     You'll be a key contributor in a fast-paced, innovation-driven team, building scalable applications using modern technologies such as React, Node.js, PostgreSQL, and TypeScript-with exposure to AWS, NestJS, and even GoLang for high-performance enhancements. If you're excited about collaborating with AI-assisted development tooling and evolving your fullstack expertise in a high-ownership environment, this is the opportunity for you.     Key Responsibilities  Design, develop, and maintain fullstack web applications using JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Node.js. Develop backend APIs using frameworks like NestJS and/or raw Node.js. Work with PostgreSQL databases to ensure scalable and reliable data modeling and access. Leverage Docker and AWS to deploy and scale cloud-native applications. Apply Vibe Coding principles in a collaborative team environment, supported by AI-assisted tooling. Write clean, maintainable code and contribute to code reviews, technical planning, and design discussions. Collaborate across distributed teams in multiple time zones using async-friendly communication and documentation. Continuously seek to improve system performance, developer experience, and operational efficiency-including exploring GoLang for performance-critical components.     Required Qualifications  7+ years of hands-on fullstack development in large-scale enterprise environments. Advanced enterprise proficiency in JavaScript and TypeScript. Strong work experience with React and Node.js in production. Solid understanding and hands-on work experience with PostgreSQL. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, modern dev workflows, and agile practices. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically in ambiguous situations. Comfortable with cross-functional collaboration and asynchronous communication. Exposure to or interest in AI-powered development workflows and productivity tools. Comfort with the advantages and trade-offs of Vibe Coding methodologies. Knowledge of Docker and containerized development workflows. Hands-on experience working within AWS cloud services and deployment pipelines.     Preferred Skills  Experience with NestJS for building efficient, scalable server-side applications. Familiarity with GoLang for performance enhancement or backend service optimization.     Unable to partner with 3rd party vendors (Corp-to-Corp/C2C) for this opportunity. We are unable to sponsor at this time. Relocation assistance is not provided.

About the job  SRA / Associate Scientist ‚Äì Protein Purification & ADC Development  üìç San Francisco Bay Area | Full-Time | Onsite  Join Celltheon and help develop the next generation of biologics and ADCs  Celltheon is seeking a motivated, detail-oriented scientist to join our Protein Purification & Analytics team.  In this hands-on laboratory role, you will contribute to the development, optimization, and scale-up of purification processes for recombinant proteins and conjugated modalities ‚Äî including monoclonal antibodies, bispecifics, Fc-fusions, difficult-to-express proteins, and antibody-drug conjugates (ADCs).  You will work closely with experienced scientists across molecular biology, cell culture, and manufacturing to support projects from early-stage development through GMP readiness.  Key Responsibilities  Assist in developing and optimizing 1‚Äì3 column purification workflows (SEC, ProA, CEX, AEX, HIC, IMAC, mixed modes) for mammalian-expressed proteins. Experience with Hamilton's for HTP purification method development.  Support purification and characterization of ADCs and conjugated proteins in collaboration with our bioconjugation team. Perform analytical assays such as Protein A HPLC for titer, SEC-HPLC, CEX-HPLC, RP-HPLC, SDS-PAGE, and ADC-specific methods (training provided). Operate and maintain FPLC and analytical HPLC systems, including cleaning and changeovers. Accurately document all work in ELNs, batch records, and SOPs. Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to troubleshoot and solve technical challenges.  What We‚Äôre Looking For  Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Biotechnology, Biochemistry, Bioprocessing, or related field plus 3-4 years industry experience (Master‚Äôs degree preferred). Hands-on laboratory experience with protein purification (FPLC experience strongly preferred). Familiarity with analytical HPLC and chromatography methods a plus. Interest or experience in ADC purification/characterization is desirable. Strong attention to detail, organizational skills, and ELN proficiency. Team player with excellent communication skills.  About Celltheon  Celltheon Corporation is a biotechnology company in the San Francisco Bay Area specializing in advanced expression technologies and ADC development.  Our proprietary platforms ‚Äî OmniCHO‚Ñ¢ for transient expression, Goldilocks‚Ñ¢ Transposase for stable cell line development, and SUPER CELL‚Ñ¢ CHOK1 for difficult-to-express proteins ‚Äî deliver high titers, exceptional quality, and rapid timelines.  We provide end-to-end solutions from molecular design through manufacturing-scale processes, including full bioconjugation services for ADCs.  At Celltheon, you‚Äôll work in a collaborative, fast-paced environment where creativity is encouraged, challenges are welcomed, and your contributions make an immediate impact.

About the job  Job Description  It is the responsibility of the Project Executive (PX) to act as the chief liaison between Vernon and the owner, architect, engineer, specialty consultants, and other members of the project team. It is the PX‚Äôs responsibility to ensure that the team is working harmoniously and meeting the overall project‚Äôs requirements, such as completing the project on schedule, within budget, and according to quality specifications. It is also the PX‚Äôs responsibility to acquire the proper resources to perform the work, often from department heads, or arrange for the hiring of personnel with the Human Resources department. The PX needs to keep upper management informed about the overall project status and bring major issues to upper management‚Äôs attention. The PX should also cultivate and maintain a positive relationship with all members of the project team (owner, lenders, brokers, consultants, and trade associations). The PX is ultimately responsible for the satisfaction of the client. The PX is involved in multiple projects at a time.      Responsibilities  ¬∑ Provide leadership in business judgment and all financial and profitability aspects of projects under your jurisdiction.     ¬∑ Participate extensively in the work acquisition process, working to define and develop project budgets and schedules that will achieve profitability objectives taking into account project-specific challenges.     ¬∑ Set appropriate milestones and assign staff qualified to handle the scope and complexity of the project.  ¬∑ Work closely with clients, owners, architects and subcontractors to develop relationships that exceed the client satisfaction to Vernon‚Äôs demanding standards.     ¬∑ Provide oversight in managing all necessary resources throughout the entire project from start-up through closeout and ensure that the Owner‚Äôs expectations regarding budget, schedule, and quality, as well as Vernon‚Äôs profitability objectives are met or exceeded. It is expected that the Project Executive owns the project from Pre-Construction thru Closeout and beyond. This involves:  o Oversight of projects at a high level from beginning to end including budget, costs, unexpected events, general performance, and overall progress against plan.  o Ensure that the day-to-day operations of projects are transitioned effectively to Project Managers and Superintendents from Preconstruction when work commences in the field.  o Mentor, train and coach staff to perform to or exceed Vernon standards.  o Represent Vernon to the Owner(s), Architects, Consultants, Government Authorities, Vendors and Subcontractors.     ¬∑ Project Acquisition  o Participate in bidding and estimating process to win projects  o Participate to understand unique owner needs, to represent Vernon capabilities and help close potential clients.  o Review projects for unique challenges that will impact budget/profitability objectives   o Utilize industry contacts and relationships to generate appropriate project leads and follow through to acquisition as required.  o Participate in and contribute to the RFP response process including editing for project specific content, and interview preparation and participation as requested.  o Participate in Contract negotiation      ¬∑ Project Start Up/Turnover/Pre-Construction  o Assign appropriate Project Staff (Includes Project Management and Field Staff)  o Review and approve the pre-mobilization activities.  o Ensure Turnover meeting occurs between Preconstruction and Operation teams  o Be the pre-construction lead as requested, working closely with the pre-construction and estimating teams to develop project specific budgets, schedules and logistics plans.  o Responsible for ensuring that Projects achieve budget, schedule, quality and profitability objectives.  ¬ß Maintain a thorough understanding of the Vernon/Owner Contract. Ensure project team understanding of same and that project achieves compliance with.  ¬ß Visit sites regularly to monitor project performance, schedule, and expenditures with project staff, highlight potential challenges and provide leadership in responding creatively to bring projects in on schedule and under budget, and to the standard of quality expected.     ¬∑ People:  o Monitor and evaluate Project Manager and Superintendent staff assignments  o Responsible for development of entire team  o Assist in sourcing and screening of candidates as requested; mentor, coach and train them to perform and ensure effective matching of talent to project scope     ¬∑ Financial Performance  o Cash Management  o Accounts Receivable  o Accurate Financial Forecasting  o P&L including full understanding of project contingencies, liabilities and savings potential     ¬∑ Schedule Performance  o Assist the project staff in the development of the Baseline Schedule  o Monitor schedule performance  o Assist the project team in initiation of workflow  o Ensure Project Staff understands and is trained in company procedures and monitor compliance     ¬∑ Safety  o Champion jobsite safety effort, motivating the on-site team in the implementation of Vernon‚Äôs ‚ÄòWinning‚Äô Safety Culture     ¬∑ Meeting Management  o Attend all scheduled meetings necessary to monitor and manage project profitability  o Chair and/or attend weekly project staff meetings     ¬∑ Client Relationships  o Attend owner and project meetings, maintain continuous client contact to gauge performance perceptions and communicate relevant information to Project Team  o Become the Vernon representative on the team     Qualifications  ¬∑ Bachelor‚Äôs degree with a minimum of 10-15 years of construction management experience for a GC or CM at Risk firm  ¬∑ In-depth knowledge of intricate commercial construction practices required  ¬∑ Experience leading multiple successful project teams including development of direct reports and maintaining relationships with external entities  ¬∑ The ability to manage and embrace change. Respond and adapt to new processes.  ¬∑ Proactive, not reactive ‚Äì ability to foresee, anticipate and resolve issues before they happen  ¬∑ Experience working for New York State and New York City agencies (DASNY, OGS, SUCF, DDC, SCA, NYCHH, etc.)     If your answer to the following questions is ‚ÄúYES‚Äù then we encourage you to apply!  ¬∑ Are you interested in working with the best & brightest construction professionals in the NYC market?  ¬∑ Do you align with Vernon‚Äôs core values: Teamwork & Leadership, Innovation, Integrity, Quality, Relationships, and Safety?  ¬∑ Are you positive, energized, and passionate about your work?  ¬∑ Do you have a growth mindset and are constantly seeking perpetual improvement?  ¬∑ Do you have what it takes to help us in our vision to redefine the standard of excellence in our industry?     Salary  ¬∑ $200,000 - $275,000

Job Title: Full Stack Software Developer with verification
Description: About the job  Our Mission  At Palo Alto Networks¬Æ everything starts and ends with our mission:  Being the cybersecurity partner of choice, protecting our digital way of life.  Our vision is a world where each day is safer and more secure than the one before. We are a company built on the foundation of challenging and disrupting the way things are done, and we‚Äôre looking for innovators who are as committed to shaping the future of cybersecurity as we are.  Job Description  We are seeking a versatile and talented Full Stack Software Developer to design, develop, and maintain robust and scalable software applications. As a core member of our development team, you will manage the full application lifecycle, from front-end user experience to back-end logic and data management. While your primary focus will be on software development, you will also play a crucial role in integrating pre-existing AI/ML models and services to build new, intelligent features within our applications. The ideal candidate has a passion for building user-centric software and is eager to explore and integrate emerging AI capabilities to create a more powerful product.  Key Responsibilities   Full Stack Application Development: Build and maintain web applications using modern front-end frameworks and robust back-end services. Feature Integration: Implement new features and functionality across the application stack, from crafting user-facing interfaces to developing back-end APIs. AI/ML Integration: Work with APIs and specialized cloud services to integrate pre-built AI/ML models (e.g., natural language processing, generative AI, or recommendation engines) into application features. API Development: Design and develop RESTful or GraphQL APIs to enable communication between the front-end, back-end, and AI/ML services. Automated Testing and Pipelines: Contribute to the development and maintenance of automated testing and deployment pipelines to ensure code quality and stability. Database Management: Interact with relational and non-relational databases to manage data and optimize queries for application performance. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Partner with product managers, designers, and AI/ML engineers to understand business requirements and translate them into effective technical solutions. Troubleshooting and Maintenance: Debug, maintain, and upgrade existing software, addressing issues across the entire application stack.   Qualifications  Required Skills and Qualifications   Technical Experience: 5+ years of experience in full stack software development. AI Rapid Development: Strong experience with generative AI development tools (e.g., Gemini CLI, Claude Code, Codex CLI) to accelerate the software development lifecycle, including code generation, debugging, and workflow automation. Back-End Development: Strong experience with server-side languages and frameworks such as Python (Flask, Django) and Typescript (Node.js). AI/ML Knowledge (Integration Focus): Strong experience integrating pre-trained AI/ML models and APIs (e.g., OpenAI, AWS AI Services, Google Cloud AI). No primary experience in model training is required. API Integrations: Strong experience designing, building, and consuming APIs. Front-End Development: Strong experience in HTML, CSS, and Typescript using a modern front-end framework like React, Angular, or Vue.js. Version Control: Proficiency with version control systems like Git. Databases: Proficiency with database management systems, both SQL (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and NoSQL (e.g., MongoDB). Problem-Solving: Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail.   Preferred Qualifications   Experience with ReactJS development in NextJS. Experience with developing CI/CD pipelines in Gitlab. Experience working with cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP. Experience with generative AI models and prompt engineering. Experience in an Agile/Scrum development environment. Proficient with containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes).   Additional Information  Compensation Disclosure  The compensation offered for this position will depend on qualifications, experience, and work location. Job Title: AI Contact Center (CCaaS) Support Engineer - (Two Positions)
Description: About the job  AI Contact Center (CCaaS) Support Engineer - (Two Positions)     Contivio is a global leader in AI-ready enterprise SaaS contact center and telephony solutions. Our patented toolbar and CRM integration technologies power multi-channel, AI-capable communication platforms that help businesses improve sales and customer support.     We‚Äôre hiring two Support Engineers (one Senior and one Junior) to join our U.S. operations onsite at our Irvine, CA headquarters. This is not a remote position. Local candidates or those willing to commute daily are strongly preferred.     The ideal candidate has a strong VoIP or CCaaS background, thrives in a fast-paced, customer-driven environment, and takes ownership of deliverables and deadlines. For the senior position, we‚Äôre especially looking for someone who can lead the Irvine-based team and ensure technical and customer success.     Responsibilities  Triage, troubleshoot, and resolve customer issues related to Contivio‚Äôs VoIP and contact center platform. Reproduce, document, and escalate product defects to Engineering. Act as a liaison between customers, Engineering, and Product teams. Lead by example in accountability, customer satisfaction, and technical excellence. Contribute to our knowledge base through documentation and videos. Collaborate with global teams in the U.S., Egypt and Australia.     Requirements  BS/BA in Computer Science, Communications Engineering, or equivalent experience. 2‚Äì3+ years of hands-on experience with VoIP / Contact Center platforms (e.g., Five9, InContact, DialPad, Avaya, Cisco, etc.) for senior role. 1‚Äì2 years of relevant technical experience or transferable skills for junior role. Strong understanding of SIP, RTP, STUN, HTTP, TCP/IP. Solid networking fundamentals: routing, switching, NAT, QoS, firewalls. Experience using Wireshark, ping, traceroute, and similar tools. Proven ability to troubleshoot remotely and communicate clearly with customers. Customer-first mindset and accountability for deliverables and timelines.     Preferred (Senior Role)  Experience leading or mentoring technical teams. Familiarity with CRM-integrated telephony or CCaaS platforms. Demonstrated success meeting project deadlines under pressure.     Location and Compensation  Location: Onsite at Contivio HQ, Irvine, CA (local candidates strongly preferred) Competitive salary based on experience, performance-based bonuses, and full benefits package.     How to Apply   Apply via LinkedIn and email a short note to Careers@contivio.com including:  Your hands-on VoIP experience (tools, protocols, and projects) Confirmation that you are local to or can commute to Irvine, CA Why you‚Äôre excited to join Contivio     Applicants who exaggerate their VoIP or CCaaS experience will be technically tested during the hiring process.     Contivio is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or veteran status.

Job Title: Member to Technical Staff - Engineering with verification
Description: About the job  Job Description  We‚Äôre partnering with a fast-growing AI company that‚Äôs building core infrastructure to power the next generation of intelligent systems. Their mission is to develop realistic RL environments, high-fidelity simulated data, and representative tasks that enable more capable, reliable AI agents - and ultimately drive large-scale economic impact. Job Title: Director of Project Management with verification
Description: About the job  Location: Brooklyn, NY, Hybrid   Job Type: Full-time,   Reports to: CFO/COO  Salary: $120,000 - $150,000 DOE  Benefits: Medical, 401(k), PTO     About Now What  We are a research, insights, and strategy consultancy that works with bold, curious clients like Pfizer, Apple, J&J, Nike, Novartis, Disney, and Google to tackle their most complex questions about culture, behavior, brands, and the future. Our people are researchers, strategists, anthropologists, and insight rebels who blend rigor with creativity to help clients answer the hardest question of all: Now What?     Now What Health (NWH) is our growing healthcare vertical‚Äîwhere we bring our unique blend of empathy, insight, and strategic clarity to the most urgent and complex questions facing the healthcare world. With deep roots in pharma and growing capabilities across the healthcare landscape, we're seeking an experienced, subject matter expert/client leader to help build, shape, and scale NWH for the future.     The Role: Director of Project Management      Job Overview:  We are seeking a highly organized and strategic Director of Project Management to set the standard for how client projects are executed across the company. While this role does not directly manage a team, it plays a critical leadership function by establishing the processes, best practices, and workflows that guide the work of 30+ strategists.     Working closely with the Senior Director of Research, this individual will design and implement systems that ensure project efficiency, quality, and consistency. They will be responsible for training strategists on process adoption, reinforcing best practices, and creating the operational infrastructure that elevates the team‚Äôs work.     The ideal candidate will bring experience in market research or a related field (such as an agency or consultancy), along with proven strengths in process management, vendor coordination, and financial oversight. This role requires someone who can balance strategic vision with operational rigor, ensuring the entire strategist team is equipped to deliver seamless client experiences at scale.     Key Responsibilities:  Project Standards & Process Management  Identify, develop, and implement standardized project management processes and tools to the project teams to ensure consistency and efficiency across all client engagements, with input from Senior Team Monitor project progress, ensuring adherence to established frameworks and proactively addressing potential risks. Partner with the Head of Staffing to properly onboard new projects and align resources accordingly.     Vendor & Freelancer Management  Oversee relationships with key vendors, including research recruit, panel vendors and freelance consultants, ensuring smooth collaboration and adherence to project requirements. Manage contracts, negotiations, and performance tracking for external partners. Develop a reliable freelance network and maintain a roster of skilled specialists to support project needs. Serve as a key point of contact for project-related operational matters, ensuring clear communication between internal teams and vendors on our most complex projects.     Data Security & Compliance Management  Partner with data security consultants and technology support consultants and CFO to ensure full compliance with industry standards, client requirements, and internal policies. Oversee and coordinate recurring security checks, including penetration tests, vulnerability assessments, and any other required audits. Review, complete, and maintain all client-provided data security forms, assessments, and agreements, ensuring timely and accurate submission. Update, develop, document, and implement Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) related to data protection, storage, and access control in collaboration with internal and external stakeholders. Monitor and enforce compliance with client-specific data retention and deletion policies, ensuring all project data is handled securely throughout its lifecycle. Serve as a key point of contact for data security matters within the project management function, ensuring the strategist team is informed and aligned with company standards.     Financial Oversight & Invoicing  Work closely with accounting consultants to ensure clients are invoiced accurately and in a timely manner upon project or phase completion. Partner with Head of Staffing to maintain Mavenlink (PM tool) to enhance project tracking, reporting, and collaboration. Track project budgets, ensuring financial accountability and alignment with forecasts. Monitor project profitability and identify opportunities for cost optimization.     Qualifications & Experience:  10 years of project management experience, ideally in marketing research or a related industry. Ideally has experience managing Healthcare/Pharma projects. Fielding experience a plus. Strong background in developing and maintaining project management frameworks. Experience managing vendor relationships. Familiarity with accounting processes related to invoicing and project financials. Proficiency in project management tools (e.g., Kantata, Asana, Monday.com, Trello, Smartsheet). Strong organizational, problem-solving, and communication skills.     Submit your cover letter and resume to join our curious, tight-knit, trailblazing team.

Job Title: Frontend Software Engineer - Full Stack Track
Description: About the job This job is sourced from a job board. Learn More  About Us  At InnerPlant (www.innerplant.com) we are on a mission to transform farming by enabling crops to communicate directly with farmers. By tapping into plants' immune systems, InnerPlant engineers crops that emit optical signals detectable as far away as space when under attack by disease, pests, or other stressors.  We‚Äôre backed by leading industry and venture partners, including John Deere and an alliance of North American farmers. InnerPlant is a place for people that believe they can make a difference and want to improve how decisions are made on the farm.  We are currently seeking a Frontend Engineer to push forward our work to deliver the signals from our plants to farmers. This key role would be accountable for ensuring that the software that our customers and partners use to interact with our product is intuitive, performant, and usable across the various devices present on the modern farm.  Responsibilities   Build and refine frontend interfaces our customers will use to interact with our flagship product, CropVoice. Design and implement customer data visualizations for internal stakeholders. Automate key customer interaction points, including transactional communications. Land in the frontend and expand to full stack, taking a holistic approach to systems design.   Requirements  Skills Summary   JavaScript/TypeScript and modern frontend frameworks (e.g. Svelte) Strong understanding of HTML5, CSS3 and responsive design principles Experience with common development tools and services, such as version control software, package managers, and CI/CD pipelines  Bonus software skills : at least some experience with Python-based ORMs and REST API frameworks; familiarity with map frameworks (e.g. Leaflet, Mapbox) for spatial data visualization; exposure to cloud infrastructure (e.g. AWS, GCP) and containerization  Interpersonal: Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ability to contribute to a healthy engineering culture as well as relay technical concepts to non-engineers    Education, Experience, and Attributes   Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science or related field At least one year of experience building software, with a focus on frontend components Long term mindset and outlook toward building maintainable systems Intellectual curiosity and a desire to learn about remote sensing, plant biology, and the global food system Desire to learn and grow toward backend/full stack development Ability to work both independently and collaboratively as part of a team   Benefits  The US annual compensation range for this position is $91,000 to $133,000. Within the range, individual pay is determined by factors including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training.  InnerPlant provides an amazing opportunity to work on some of the hardest problems facing humanity and help design the agricultural systems of the future. In addition to working with a fun team, we offer competitive compensation, benefits, and growth opportunities.  InnerPlant provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Title: Manager, Engineering, CNBC Web & Make It
Description: About the job  Company Description  NBCUniversal is one of the world's leading media and entertainment companies. We create world-class content, which we distribute across our portfolio of film, television, and streaming, and bring to life through our theme parks and consumer experiences. We own and operate leading entertainment and news brands, including NBC, NBC News, MSNBC, CNBC, NBC Sports, Telemundo, NBC Local Stations, Bravo, USA Network, and Peacock, our premium ad-supported streaming service. We produce and distribute premier filmed entertainment and programming through Universal Filmed Entertainment Group and Universal Studio Group, and have world-renowned theme parks and attractions through Universal Destinations & Experiences. NBCUniversal is a subsidiary of Comcast Corporation.  Our impact is rooted in improving the communities where our employees, customers, and audiences live and work. We have a rich tradition of giving back and ensuring our employees have the opportunity to serve their communities. We champion an inclusive culture and strive to attract and develop a talented workforce to create and deliver a wide range of content reflecting our world.  Comcast NBCUniversal has announced its intent to create a new publicly traded company ('Versant') comprised of most of NBCUniversal's cable television networks, including USA Network, CNBC, MSNBC, Oxygen, E!, SYFY and Golf Channel along with complementary digital assets Fandango, Rotten Tomatoes, GolfNow, GolfPass, and SportsEngine. The well-capitalized company will have significant scale as a pure-play set of assets anchored by leading news, sports and entertainment content. The spin-off is expected to be completed during 2025.  Job Description  We are seeking an experienced and motivated Engineering Manager to guide the technical direction of the CNBC Web & Make It engineering team. This individual will blend strategic thinking, strong hands-on development skills, and mentoring capabilities to drive technical excellence and innovation across our platforms. The Engineering Manager will serve as both a contributor and a coordinator‚Äîensuring that architectural standards, team alignment, and engineering best practices are upheld while continuously delivering value to our audience.  Key Responsibilities:  Technical Leadership   Drive technical excellence and innovation across the team and product ecosystem Lead architecture and system integration efforts to ensure scalable, performant, and secure solutions Define and evolve platform direction, architectural patterns, and best practices Spearhead technical spikes and experiments, evaluating emerging technologies and frameworks   Team Guidance & Collaboration   Provide technical mentorship and foster continuous learning and development Lead code reviews and offer thoughtful, constructive feedback Deliver system design presentations and promote knowledge-sharing Ensure alignment across engineering managers and tech leads for platform consistency and interoperability   Hands-On Contribution   Contribute to the codebase depending on project needs Lead by example with high-quality, maintainable code and strong development practices   Operations & Planning   Engage in technical capacity planning to support scalability and growth Own system SLAs, metrics, and observability to ensure platform reliability Serve as the escalation point for production issues and lead cross-functional incident responses Collaborate on roadmap planning to align technical strategy with business objectives   Process & Visibility   Continuously improve development processes to enhance efficiency and quality Champion team visibility by highlighting accomplishments and technical contributions Support delivery coordination and people management when needed   Qualifications   Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field 7+ years of professional software development experience, with at least 3 years in a technical leadership role Proven experience designing and integrating large-scale distributed systems Deep understanding of software development best practices including testing, CI/CD, observability, and performance optimization Demonstrated ability to lead through influence, alignment, and technical guidance   Technical Proficiency   Experience with a modern JavaScript framework (i.e. React.js)  Strong skills in either CSS/Sass development  Experience implementing responsive designs using HTML and CSS preprocessors (SASS, PostCSS, LESS)  Proficiency with modular JavaScript, async patterns, and DOM manipulation  Experience optimizing rendering performance - critical rendering path, TTFB, caching strategies, optimizing javascript execution.  Strong skills in unit testing and test driven development  Proficiency in integration testing (e.g. Cypress)  Understanding of bundlers, transpilers, and preprocessors (Webpack, Babel, SASS)  Experience with version control systems (e.g., Git)    Nice to Have   Experience working in cross-functional agile teams Familiarity with DevOps tools and practices Experience with CDN integration and site performance tooling Understanding of editorial workflows or CMS-driven environments (WordPress or similar)   What We Offer  At CNBC Headquarters in Englewood Cliffs, NJ, you‚Äôll have access to great perks and amenities:   Sweat it out ‚Äì Free onsite fitness center with state-of-the-art equipment, plus daily group classes Eat up ‚Äì Gourmet cafeteria with daily specials plus soup and salad bars Commute-friendly ‚Äì Free shuttle transportation to and from multiple locations in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Hoboken, and Jersey City   Additional Information    Hybrid: This position has been designated as hybrid, generally contributing from the office a minimum of three days per week. This position is eligible for company sponsored benefits, including medical, dental and vision insurance, 401(k), paid leave, tuition reimbursement, and a variety of other discounts and perks. Learn more about the benefits offered by NBCUniversal by visiting the Benefits page of the Careers website.  Salary range: $155,000-$175,000 (bonus eligible)   Additional Information  As part of our selection process, external candidates may be required to attend an in-person interview with an NBCUniversal employee at one of our locations prior to a hiring decision. NBCUniversal's policy is to provide equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, gender identity or expression, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, veteran status, membership in the uniformed services, genetic information, or any other basis protected by applicable law.  If you are a qualified individual with a disability or a disabled veteran and require support throughout the application and/or recruitment process as a result of your disability, you have the right to request a reasonable accommodation. You can submit your request to AccessibilitySupport@nbcuni.com.  Although you'll be hired as an NBCU employee, your employment and the responsibilities associated with this job likely will transition to Versant in the future. By joining at this pivotal time, you'll be a part of this exciting company as it takes shape.

Job Title: Front-End Web Developer, Minecraft with verification
Description: About the job  At Mojang Studios, the creators of Minecraft, we are on a mission to build a better world through the power of play.  Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It‚Äôs the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.  We enable millions to create and play together, connect people across the globe, and foster a community that is among the most active and passionate in the world. Our community is global and incredibly diverse. When we are developing anything within our franchise, we keep this in mind. We want everyone to not only feel included in Minecraft, but also to see themselves in what we make. Our goal is for the Mojang Studios team to be as diverse as our community.  The Mojang Web Team is seeking a Front-End Web Developer to help craft modern, engaging web experiences for the global Minecraft community. As a Front-End Web Developer you‚Äôll be at the heart of building and evolving the main Minecraft website‚Äîbringing the charm and creativity of Minecraft to life on the web.  In this role, you‚Äôll collaborate closely with studio partners and cross-functional teams to design and develop responsive, accessible, and maintainable web interfaces. You‚Äôll be empowered to apply mature engineering practices while infusing the site with the playful whimsical spirit that defines Minecraft.  Microsoft‚Äôs mission is to empower every person and every organization on the planet to achieve more. As employees we come together with a growth mindset, innovate to empower others, and collaborate to realize our shared goals. Each day we build on our values of respect, integrity, and accountability to create a culture of inclusion where everyone can thrive at work and beyond  In the end, it‚Äôs the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you‚Äôll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals ‚Äì all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!  Responsibilities   Deliver delightful, business-critical web experiences that meet high standards of quality, performance, and reliability.  Apply modern engineering best practices to build responsive, accessible, and scalable web solutions that are easy to maintain and extend.  Collaborate across Mojang teams to understand product needs and translate them into impactful web solutions.  Build and nurture cross-discipline relationships to ensure cohesive, player-focused experiences that reflect the spirit of Minecraft.  Builds an understanding of customer needs to inform design and implementation decisions.  Embody our Culture  & Values   Qualifications  Required Qualifications:    Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related technical field AND 2+ years technical engineering experience with coding in languages including, but not limited to, C, C++, C#, Java, JavaScript, or Python OR equivalent experience. 2+ years of experience implementing applications using JavaScript and HTML, with an understanding of modern web standards and browser behaviors.  1+ years of experience using version control systems similar to Git.  2+ years of experience solving technical challenges in web application development, including debugging, performance optimization, and cross-browser compatibility.   Preferred Qualifications   Experience with CSS (Cascading Style Sheets), TypeScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React).  Understanding web accessibility standards and inclusive design principles.  Ability to work and collaborate in a cross-functional team environment.  Experience building responsive and accessible web user interfaces, with attention to performance and usability.  Passion for crafting user experiences and attention to details    Software Engineering IC3 - The typical base pay range for this USDe across the U.S. is USD $100,600 - $199,000 per year. There is a different range applicable to specific work locations, within the San Francisco Bay area and New York City metropolitan area, and the base pay range for this rolUSDn those locations is USD $131,400 - $215,400 per year.  Certain roles may be eligible for benefits and other compensation. Find additional benefits anhttps information here: https://careers.microsoft.com/us/en/us-corporate-pay  Microsoft will accept applications for the role until October 31, 2025.  Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, ancestry, color, family or medical care leave, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, political affiliation, protected veteran status, race, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances. About the job  About Us:  Live experiences help people cross today‚Äôs digital divide and focus on what truly connects us ‚Äì the here, the now, this once-in-a-lifetime moment that‚Äôs bringing us together. To fulfill Gametime‚Äôs mission of uniting the world through shared experiences, we make it easy for people to discover and access the live experiences that matter most.  With platforms on iOS, Android, mobile web and desktop supporting more than 60,000 events across the US and Canada, we are reimagining the event ticket industry in order to move at the speed of life.  Job Summary:  Engineering at Gametime  You will be a key contributor to the Engineering team responsible for building and maintaining the client-side applications and backend systems that power the Gametime experience for millions of users. We empower engineers to take full ownership of their code and foster a culture grounded in testing, code reviews, observability, experimentation, and operational excellence. At Gametime, we value collaboration, inclusivity, and the strength of diverse perspectives ‚Äî creating an environment where people love to build together.  We are also investing deeply in the future of AI. This includes building internal tools and workflows powered by AI, incorporating agentic systems into our backend architecture, and preparing our marketplace and infrastructure to be AI-ready. Engineers are encouraged to explore and adopt AI capabilities in their development process, and those who contribute to advancing AI adoption within our stack will play a key role in shaping that evolution.  The Role  We are seeking a Backend Software Engineer to join the Supply Product team. This team is responsible for the technology and systems that power the supply side of the Gametime marketplace. This is a mid-level individual contributor (IC2) position for engineers who are developing their technical depth, execute reliably on scoped projects, and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. You‚Äôll contribute to delivering backend features and infrastructure improvements while learning from senior engineers and growing toward greater autonomy.  Key Responsibilities:   Build and maintain Golang microservices that support inventory ingestion, ordering and fulfillment, and third-party integrations. Contribute to the design and development of backend features with guidance from senior team members. Write well-tested, maintainable, and observable code. Support and improve internal and external APIs that power the Gametime platform. Collaborate closely with Product, Design, and Data teams to deliver technical solutions aligned with user and business goals. Participate in team rituals including code reviews, sprint planning, and technical discussions. Learn and apply best practices in backend development, CI/CD, and system reliability. Contribute to a culture of inclusion, technical curiosity, and continuous improvement. Bonus: Explore ways to integrate AI-powered tools into backend workflows and development practices.   Key Competencies:   Backend Development: Hands-on experience building backend systems using Golang or other backend languages (e.g., Python, Java, Ruby, etc). System Fundamentals: Understanding of distributed systems principles, REST APIs, and backend application architecture. API Integration: Ability to work with internal and third-party APIs reliably and securely. Cloud Infrastructure: Exposure to AWS, GCP, or other cloud platforms is a plus. Event-Driven Systems (Bonus): Experience working with messaging systems like Kafka, RabbitMQ, or similar. Databases: Experience with relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL, MySQL) and/or NoSQL technologies (e.g. MongoDB, DynamoDB). Team Collaboration: Strong communication skills and a willingness to learn through collaboration. AI-Enhanced Development (Bonus): Interest or experience using AI tools like GitHub Copilot, Cursor, ChatGPT, or similar to enhance engineering work.   Minimum Qualifications   Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Experience: 2-4 years in software engineering, preferably with backend systems   What We can Offer:   Flexible PTO Competitive salary & equity package Monthly Gametime credits for any event ($1,200/yr) Medical, dental, & vision insurance Life insurance and disability benefits Diverse Family-forming benefits through Carrot Fertility 401k, HSA, pre-tax savings programs Company off-sites and meet-ups Wellness programs Tenure recognition   At Gametime pay ranges are subject to change and assigned to a job based on specific market median of similar jobs according to 3rd party salary benchmark surveys. Individual pay within that range can vary for several reasons including skills/capabilities, experience, and available budget.  United States - Pay Range: $124,397 USD - $146,349 USD  Gametime is committed to bringing together individuals from different backgrounds and perspectives. We strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive, feel a sense of belonging, and do great work together. As an equal opportunity employer, we prohibit any unlawful discrimination against a job applicant on the basis of their race, color, religion, veteran status, sex, parental status, gender identity or expression, transgender status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or genetic information. We respect the laws enforced by the EEOC and are dedicated to going above and beyond in fostering diversity across our company.

About the job  Overview  Collateral Partners builds the collateral behind the capital ‚Äî helping investment firms communicate with sophistication and scale through institutional-grade decks, websites, and brands.     We‚Äôre hiring a Website Strategist to lead our website practice ‚Äî overseeing every aspect of digital engagements from strategy to launch. This person will own the process, direct our designers and developers, and guide clients through building high-impact, investor-grade websites that tell a clear, compelling story.     You‚Äôll combine strategic thinking, content design, and project leadership ‚Äî shaping how investment brands express themselves online.     Responsibilities1. Digital Strategy & Structure Lead discovery sessions with clients to define objectives, audiences, and key messages. Develop information architecture, site maps, and page-level content frameworks. Translate positioning and brand strategy into digital structure and flow. Create strategic briefs outlining copy direction, visual priorities, and user experience.     2. Copywriting & Content Direction Write or oversee all website copy ‚Äî from headlines to narrative flow. Ensure clarity, precision, and brand alignment in all content. Collaborate with clients to refine tone and language throughout revisions. Maintain consistency across site sections, CTAs, and investor communications.     3. Creative & Technical Management Manage designers and developers across concept, design, and build phases. Review wireframes, layouts, and final designs for narrative coherence and UX alignment. Oversee QA for copy, visuals, and functional delivery before launch. Implement scalable digital processes and templates for recurring client needs.     4. Client Leadership & Delivery Serve as the primary client lead for website engagements. Present strategy, structure, and creative direction confidently to executive stakeholders. Manage scope, expectations, and communication across internal and external teams. Identify opportunities for ongoing retainers or expanded digital partnerships.     Qualifications 3‚Äì7 years of experience in digital strategy, web production, or creative direction. Proven record managing website projects from discovery through launch. Strong writing and storytelling skills ‚Äî capable of producing and editing investor-facing copy. Deep understanding of UX, information architecture, and responsive design. Experience managing designers, developers, and cross-functional creative teams. Background in professional services or financial brands strongly preferred. Comfortable in a high-velocity, client-facing environment with multiple concurrent projects.     You‚Äôll Thrive Here If You‚Ä¶ Love building structure and clarity from complexity. Can toggle between big-picture brand strategy and micro-level copy decisions. Excel at managing creatives and clients with equal confidence. Value precision, polish, and narrative alignment in every detail.     About Collateral Partners  Collateral Partners is a financial communications firm that builds the materials behind the capital. We combine deep financial understanding with creative excellence ‚Äî delivering world-class brand, digital, and marketing systems for investment firms globally.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer I - Member Experience with verification
Description: About the job  Our mission: to eliminate every barrier to mental health.  At Spring Health, we‚Äôre on a mission to revolutionize mental healthcare by removing every barrier that prevents people from getting the help they need, when they need it. Our clinically validated technology, Precision Mental Healthcare, empowers us to deliver the right care at the right time‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs therapy, coaching, medication, or beyond‚Äîtailored to each individual‚Äôs needs.  We proudly partner with over 450 companies, from startups to multinational Fortune 500 corporations, as a leading provider of mental health service, providing care for 10 million people. Our clients include brands you use and know like Microsoft, Target, and Delta Airlines, all of whom trust us to deliver best-in-class outcomes for their employees globally. With our innovative platform, we‚Äôve been able to generate a net positive ROI for employers and we are the only company in our category to earn external validation of net savings for customers.  We have raised capital from prominent investors including Generation Investment, Kinnevik, Tiger Global, Northzone, RRE Ventures, and many more. Thanks to their partnership and our latest Series E Funding, our current valuation has reached $3.3 billion. We‚Äôre just getting started‚Äîjoin us on our journey to make mental healthcare accessible to everyone, everywhere.  The Member Experience Engineering team builds the web and mobile experiences that Spring Health members use to access care. We blaze trails with green field innovation, iterate rapidly on feature roadmaps, and optimize the experiences to reduce friction. We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join a team responsible for growing and improving our onboarding experiences.  The role is full time, reports to a technically hands on Engineering Manager, is hybrid with our hub in NYC, with travel opportunities at least twice per year for in person events.  What You‚Äôll Be Doing   Building full stack experiences in our Ruby / React app Being an active, leading member to tech plans and mentor. Applying your passion for improving experiences and optimizing funnels Executing quickly and efficiently in a collaborative team setting Contributing to a thriving team of engineers around you    What Success Looks Like In This Role   Energetic immersion in our full stack: Ruby being the primary language Fostering a deep level of collaboration between product partners and other partners On time planned deliveries and high velocity incremental deliveries High quality engineering output, in terms of both product and codebase Trend of reducing technical debt reduction and improving engineering excellence  Peer leadership as an exemplary engineer and mentor    What We Expect From You   At least 5 years experience as a software engineer At least 3 years of experience with Ruby or similar backend language Preferably at least 3 years of experience working with frontends in React, Typescript and Javascript Track record of proactive and collaborative leadership style Track record of technical leadership, creating clarity from ambiguity    The target base salary range for this position is $159,100 - $194,150, and is part of a competitive total rewards package including stock options and benefits. Individual pay may vary from the target range and is determined by a number of factors including experience, location, internal pay equity, and other relevant business considerations. We review all employee pay and compensation programs annually using Radford Global Compensation Database at minimum to ensure competitive and fair pay.   Benefits Provided By Spring Health  Note: We have even more benefits than listed here and below, your recruiter will provide more in-depth information as you continue in the interview process. Benefits are subject to individual plan requirements and eligibility criteria.   Health, Dental, Vision benefits start on your first day at Spring. You and your dependents also receive access to One Medical accounts HSA and FSA plans are also available, with Spring contributing up to $1K for HSAs, depending on your plan type. Access to Noom, a weight management program‚Äîbased in psychology, that‚Äôs tailored to your unique needs and goals.  Access to fertility care support through Carrot, in addition to $4,000 reimbursement for related fertility expenses. Access to Wellhub, which connects employees to the best options for fitness, mindfulness, nutrition, and sleep in one subscription Access to BrightHorizons, which provides sponsored child care, back-up care, and elder care Up to $1,000 Professional Development Reimbursement a year. $200 per year donation matching to support your favorite causes. Ready to do the most impactful work of your life?
