About the job  Company Profile:     AppCard Inc. is a technology and marketing company headquartered in Manhattan, NY. Appcard has a powerful marketing tool that leverages data acquired at the point of sale (POS) via an advanced rewards program to create advanced retargeting campaigns that help businesses increase their bottom line. AppCard is unique in the loyalty space due to its patented technology which allows businesses to capture shopper identity and item level data in realtime from purchases made in store and online. The benefit of this is two fold: consumers benefit by receiving offers, incentives and coupons. Through a shopper‚Äôs interactions with the former AppCard‚Äôs platform records and learns shopper behavior and gives grocers the ability to make their data actionable to increase average basket size and systematically increase repeat purchases.     About the role:     As AppCard expands its services and integration efforts, we're seeking a Software Engineer to join our NYC-based team. This role is pivotal in developing and enhancing our platform, ensuring we continue to deliver exceptional value to our users and clients. If you're passionate about leveraging your extensive engineering expertise to drive innovation and scale cutting-edge solutions, we'd love to have you on board.     Responsibilities:  Design, develop, and maintain scalable software solutions in collaboration with your engineering peers. Participate in design and architecture reviews. Troubleshoot, identify, and resolve high-level systemic issues across platforms. Collaborate cross-functionally with customer success, support, and business teams to deliver on company goals. Bring in new technologies and frameworks as you see fit.     Skills and Qualifications:  A Rich Background: 5+ years of hands-on experience in developing high-performance distributed systems. Your journey has equipped you with best coding practices.. Technical Mastery: Deep understanding of computer science fundamentals. Expert in Python, with a strong ability to select and integrate optimal tools and technologies. Experienced in cloud platforms (e.g., AWS). Required experience with relational databases (e.g., PG). Knowledge of Java is a plus. Proactive Problem Solver: Demonstrated capability in developing and implementing efficient tools, processes, and methodologies to address challenges and enhance efficiency. You're skilled at identifying and resolving potential bottlenecks efficiently. Whenever you raise issues you bring along possible solutions as well. Independence and Initiative: The ability to lead projects from inception to delivery, demonstrating your capacity to work autonomously and produce solutions that meet or exceed project expectations. A Commitment to Excellence: An unwavering belief in the importance of documentation, recognizing that clear, comprehensive documentation is as crucial as the code itself.     Your Role and Responsibilities Will Include:  Hands-On Leadership: Direct engagement with your team and partners to develop and deploy secure, industry-standard code that's robust and ready for production. Culture of Quality: Championing a culture of quality in every aspect of the development process, ensuring that the products we deliver are of the highest standard. Clean Code: Advocating for clean code practices, ensuring that our codebase remains manageable and efficient. You'll take a proactive stance on controlling technical debt, making strategic decisions that balance immediate needs with long-term maintainability. Effective Communication: Facilitating clear and effective communication across various teams and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and efficiency in all project phases.     Things That Will Make You Happy:  A leadership team that values innovation and promotes a culture of transparency and support. Competitive compensation package, including stock options and comprehensive benefits. Opportunities for professional growth and development in a growing sector. Choice of health, dental and vision benefits. Inclusive office environment.     **This role is full-time from our NYC office**

About the job  Greylock has a long history of backing category-defining enterprise security companies such as Wiz, Palo Alto Networks, and Rubrik. We recently invested in a next-generation cybersecurity startup that is building AI agents to execute core security workflows at machine speed autonomously. The company is led by an exceptional team of former engineering and product leaders who previously scaled a multi-billion-dollar security startup before starting this venture.     They're seeking a Staff Software Engineer to be the first front-end hire on the team. This is a foundational role: rather than focusing on pixel-perfect UI, you‚Äôll be responsible for establishing the architecture, frameworks, and systems that future engineers can easily build on. Your work will prioritize scalability, developer velocity, and long-term maintainability.     What You‚Äôll Do     Define and implement the front-end architecture, frameworks, and tooling that will serve as the backbone for the engineering team. Build core design system components, state management patterns, and APIs that enable scalable development. Partner with design and product to translate user needs into technical foundations, balancing flexibility and speed over polish in the early stages. Establish best practices for testing, performance, and maintainability to ensure a robust, production-ready codebase. Mentor and guide future front-end engineers, setting high standards for technical excellence.     What We‚Äôre Looking For  5+ years of experience in front-end engineering, ideally with expertise in laying out architecture in early-stage companies or new product lines. Deep expertise in React (or modern frameworks), TypeScript, and modern build tooling. Strong systems-thinking mindset: you enjoy building the internal foundations that others build upon. Pragmatic approach, knowing when to build for scale and when to ship quickly.     Location: Open to remote, but the startup has locations in New York/San Francisco.     About Greylock:  Greylock is an early-stage investor in hundreds of remarkable companies, including Airbnb, LinkedIn, Dropbox, Workday, Figma, Facebook, Instagram, Roblox, Coinbase, and Palo Alto Networks. More can be found about us here: https://greylock.com/

Job Title: Staff Backend API Engineer with verification
Description: About the job  *Open to hiring remote across North America and Europe ‚Äî we also have offices in NYC, San Francisco, Seattle, London, and Tel Aviv     We are a global AI research and technology company focused on building Universal Simulation systems. The research we are doing and the tools we are building are maturing rapidly and are quickly becoming the foundation for how we will all soon approach making anything. From images to videos, scripted media to documentaries, graphic design to architecture, interactive games to social media, new forms of learning and the future of entertainment itself. Everyone will be empowered to make anything. There will no longer be any barriers to entry.     Our team consists of creative, open minded, caring and ambitious people who are determined to change the world. We aspire to continuously build impossible things and our ability to do so relies on building an incredible team. If you are driven to do the same, we'd love to hear from you.     About the role  We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Software Engineer for our Backend team to help us build cutting-edge, AI-powered video creation and collaboration tools. Rather than specialists, we‚Äôre seeking curiosity-driven engineers who are determined problem solvers and thrive in fast-paced, high-ownership environments. Our engineering team is highly collaborative and works on a wide variety of exciting challenges, including building backend services for interactive video processing and streaming, and deploying cutting-edge computer vision and generative models to production.     A peek at our technical stack  Our API endpoints for real-time collaboration and media asset management is written in TypeScript, and runs in ECS containers on AWS Fargate. We leverage multiple AWS-native components, such as S3, CloudFront, Lambda, Kinesis, and SQS, as building blocks of our infrastructure.     Our inference backend is written in Python (PyTorch, TorchScript), and is deployed across multiple clusters / cloud providers. We use Kubernetes for container orchestration, and k8s-native components such as Flyte, Kueue, and Kyverno efficient job orchestration. We invest in prometheus and grafana for monitoring, and Terraform to manage our infrastructure.     What you‚Äôll do  Work with a world-class engineering team pushing the boundaries of creativity and content creation on the browser Own the full API lifecycle from design and implementation to monitoring, optimization, and documentation for both public and internal APIs Implement comprehensive API security, rate limiting, authentication, and monitoring systems to ensure reliability at scale Improve the performance, reliability, and code quality of our codebases     What you‚Äôll need  4+ years of industry experience in a backend focused software engineering role Fluency of one or more programming languages; TypeScript preferred Experience with PostgreSQL, including query optimization, indexing, and database design Experience architecting production-ready systems at scale using cloud primitives from AWS, GCP, or Azure Ability to rapidly prototype solutions and iterate on them with tight product deadlines Humility and open mindedness; at Runway we love to learn from one another     Runway strives to recruit and retain exceptional talent from diverse backgrounds while ensuring pay equity for our team. Our salary ranges are based on competitive market rates for our size, stage and industry, and salary is just one part of the overall compensation package we provide.     There are many factors that go into salary determinations, including relevant experience, skill level and qualifications assessed during the interview process, and maintaining internal equity with peers on the team. The range shared below is a general expectation for the function as posted, but we are also open to considering candidates who may be more or less experienced than outlined in the job description. In this case, we will communicate any updates in the expected salary range.     Lastly, the provided range is the expected salary for candidates in the U.S. Outside of those regions, there may be a change in the range, which again, will be communicated to candidates.

Job Title: Software Engineer 2, Supply Chain Delivery (REMOTE) with verification
Description: About the job  Req159507  Position Purpose  The Software Engineer II is responsible for independently developing and assisting in the design of a product that our customers and associates love. As a Software Engineer II, you will be part of a dynamic team with engineers of all experience levels who help each other build and grow technical and leadership skills while creating, deploying, and supporting production applications. In addition, Software Engineer IIs may be involved in configuration, security, resilience, performance tuning, and production monitoring.  Key Responsibilities   60% Delivery and Execution - Collaborates and pairs with other product team members (UX, engineering, and product management) to create secure, reliable, scalable software solutions; Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met; Works with Product Team to ensure user stories that are developer-ready, easy to understand, and testable; Writes custom code or scripts to automate infrastructure, monitoring services, and test cases; Writes custom code or scripts to do destructive testing to ensure adequate resiliency in production; Program configuration/modification and setup activities on large projects using HD approved methodology; Configures commercial off the shelf solutions to align with evolving business needs Creates meaningful dashboards, logging, alerting, and responses to ensure that issues are captured and addressed proactively 20% Learning - Actively seeks ways to grow and be challenged using both formal and informal development channels; Learns through successful and failed experiments when tackling new problems 20% Plans and Aligns - Collaborates with other team members in agile processes; Assists in creating new and better ways for the team to be successful; Relates openly and comfortably with diverse groups of people; Builds partnerships and works collaboratively with others to meet shared objectives   Direct Manager/Direct Reports   This position typically reports to the Software Engineer Manager or Sr. Manager This position has 0 Direct Reports   Travel Requirements   No travel required.   Physical Requirements   Most of the time is spent sitting in a comfortable position, with frequent opportunities to move about. On rare occasions, there may be a need to move or lift light articles.   Working Conditions   Located in a comfortable indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.   Minimum Qualifications   Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States.   Preferred Qualifications   1‚Äì3 years of professional software engineering experience, ideally supporting supply chain, logistics, or carrier communications systems Proficiency in Java, with hands-on experience developing and maintaining object-oriented applications Practical experience working with Cassandra or other distributed NoSQL databases, including data modeling and query optimization Experience deploying, managing, and troubleshooting applications on Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) or similar container orchestration platforms Strong understanding of microservice-based architectures and building scalable, resilient backend services Familiarity with writing SQL queries against relational databases and integrating with both relational and NoSQL data stores Experience with source code version control systems (such as Git), including branching, merging, and code review best practices Exposure to CI/CD pipelines and automated deployment tools Experience with modern debugging, monitoring, and root cause analysis techniques in distributed systems Exposure to security frameworks for user and service authentication and authorization Experience creating and executing unit, integration, and performance tests Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML, CSS, JavaScript/TypeScript frameworks) is a plus Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional, agile team environment   Minimum Education   The knowledge, skills, and abilities typically acquired through the completion of a bachelor's degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job.   Preferred Education   No additional education   Minimum Years Of Work Experience   2   Preferred Years Of Work Experience   No additional years of experience   Minimum Leadership Experience   None   Preferred Leadership Experience   None   Certifications   None   Competencies   Global Perspective Manages Ambiguity Nimble Learning Self-Development Collaborates Cultivates Innovation Situational Adaptability Communicates Effectively Drives Results Interpersonal Savvy   Benefits offered include healthcare benefits, a 401 (k) plan, ESPP, paid time off, and a success-sharing bonus. For a full list of the various benefits The Home Depot offers, visit https://careers.homedepot.com/our-benefits.

About the job  About the Role  INVEXOS is seeking an experienced Full-Stack Engineer to build our applicant tracking system from the ground up. You'll own the entire technical architecture from database design to candidate-facing interfaces and rapidly deliver a production-ready ATS that transforms how we manage recruiting and hiring. This is a high-impact role for an engineer who understands recruiting workflows, thrives on greenfield development, and wants to see their work directly influence how we build our teams.     Work Authorization: Must be authorized to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship now or in the future     What You'll Do  Architect and build the complete ATS from scratch including candidate pipeline management, job postings, application workflows, interview coordination, and hiring analytics Design scalable database schemas for candidate data, recruiting workflows, and multi-stage hiring pipelines Build robust APIs and integrations for resume parsing, job board distribution, calendar scheduling, email communication, and background check services Create intuitive interfaces for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates that make complex hiring workflows simple and efficient Make critical technical decisions about system architecture, data models, and integrations‚Äîthen ship features quickly to support our growing organization     What We're Looking For     Required Qualifications  5-8 years of full-stack development experience with proven ability to architect and build complete systems independently, including deep backend expertise in Node.js, Python, Ruby on Rails, or similar frameworks and strong frontend skills with React, Vue.js, or Angular ATS, HR Tech, or Recruiting Software experience with previous work building recruiting platforms, with an understanding of recruiting workflows, candidate pipelines, interview coordination, and hiring processes Database and API expertise designing complex schemas for workflow automation and multi-stage pipelines, plus experience building integrations with job boards, calendar systems, email platforms, and document processing (resume parsing highly valuable) Startup or early-stage experience coding products quickly in fast-paced environments, making sound technical tradeoffs autonomously, and owning features end-to-end from architecture to deployment Work authorization to work in the United States without requiring sponsorship now or in the future, with cloud platform proficiency (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and comfort with modern development practices     What We Value  Fast Learner: Ability to pick up new technologies and concepts quickly Self-Starter: Proactive about asking questions and seeking solutions Communication: Clear written and verbal communication skills Attention to Detail: Pride in writing clean, well-tested code Growth Mindset: Eager to receive feedback and continuously improve     Work Arrangement  Location: Chicago, IL (hybrid) Schedule: 3-4 days a week required in-office (Gold Coast Chicago) for collaboration and mentorship     Compensation & Benefits  Salary: $120,000 - $160,000 based on experience and background Equity: Equity stake in a growing company     What We're Building  You'll be working on systems that include:  Business applications that drive private equity operations Relationship management tools Financial data integration and reporting platforms  This isn't about building trivial features‚Äîyou'll work on real, complex problems that matter to the business.     Our Culture  Small Team: Everyone's contribution matters and is visible Move Fast: We ship quickly and iterate based on feedback Learn by Doing: We believe the best way to grow is by building real things High Standards: We care about code quality, but we also ship and learn Direct Communication: No corporate BS‚Äîwe're honest about what's working and what isn't     Ready to Apply?  We're looking for hungry, smart engineers who want to grow fast in a startup environment. If you're excited about building real products, learning from experienced engineers, and having meaningful impact early in your career, we want to hear from you.

Job Title: Ruby Backend Software Engineer with verification
Description: About the job  Candidates Must be located 50-100 miles from one of the following locations:   Morristown, NJ;  Boston, MA;  Atlanta, GA;  St Petersburg, FL;  St Louis, MO; or  Plano, TX.     Our ideal candidate is a Ruby Backend Software Engineer (2-3 years) with experience building scalable production applications, working with large data sets, and owning the entire development lifecycle. You will need to be a team player while collaborating closely with our product managers to enhance our mature, complex product. You will get to work with Angular, Ruby, AWS, among other technologies.     We offer comprehensive onboarding, career guidance, a competitive salary, a remote-friendly workspace, and continuing education support. We follow an Agile methodology in small software teams. This is an amazing opportunity for a hands-on, motivated Software Engineer who can define and implement new and challenging technical projects.     What You‚Äôll Do:  Write easily maintainable, extendable, and understandable code that adheres to software engineering design principles. Creating and maintaining our APIs. Developing new full-stack features to improve our products. Supporting and enhancing current systems. Debugging and optimizing code. Supporting and development of comprehensive documentation and tests. Building tooling to improve our operational efficiency. Developing the frontend experience using Angular. Creating and maintaining our Backend architecture. Planning and maintaining a product long term. Performing code reviews. Collaborating with product to deliver on the roadmap.     What You‚Äôll Bring to Zelis:  2-3 years of backend development experience in Ruby. Solid understanding of system design, data structures, and algorithms. Understanding on how to build distributed high-volume services in Ruby. Knowledge of development best practices (agile methodologies, code reviews, backend testing frameworks). Experience in backend architecture. Experience with or understanding of front-end development, particularly Angular, to effectively collaborate on full-stack features Experience working with AWS. Knowledge of API architecture development and optimization. Solid understanding of relational databases like PostgreSQL. Understanding of Apache Solr or willingness to learn. Exposure to queueing systems such as RabbitMQ or willingness to learn. Experience contributing to products in a production environment (product lifecycle, sticking to release schedules, etc.). Knowledge of development best practices (agile methodologies, code reviews, JavaScript testing frameworks).     Our Stack  Languages (JavaScript, Typescript, Ruby) Frameworks (Angular, Ruby on Rails) Infrastructure (RDS, EC2, S3, CloudFront, Redis, Docker, Jenkins, PostgreSQL, RabbitMQ, Apache Solr)

About the job  ARKA Group L.P. (‚ÄúARKA‚Äù) is an advanced technologies company serving the U.S. military, intelligence community, and commercial space industry delivering next-generation solutions to support the national security space enterprise. Built on more than six decades of excellence, ARKA brings modern approaches and a culture of innovation to the challenges of today.  By joining our team, you will be part of teams building innovative software solutions to support users in the defense and intelligence communities. Your strong technical skills and passion for innovation will be instrumental in supporting our customers and their missions to keep us safe.  Position Overview  We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Java Developer who can be a technical leader and drive projects from conception to completion, ensuring the delivery of high-quality software solutions. This role requires a blend of hands-on coding expertise, strategic planning, and excellent communication skills to bridge the gap between business needs and technical implementation.  The team is primarily based in Ypsilanti, Michigan and we welcome candidates from that area, however, remote candidates may also be considered. Candidates will be asked to obtain a TS//SCI security clearance.  In support of work/life balance, many positions are available for a flexible schedule within the pay period. Ask us about the opportunity for flex scheduling if that‚Äôs of interest to you.  Responsibilities   Software Development: Design, document, develop, and maintain robust, high-performance, and scalable applications using Java and related technologies Technical Architecture: Contribute to updating and modernizing the architectural design of the existing system, ensuring it is designed for usability, performance efficiency, maintainability and cyber-security. Ultimately optimizing for cloud deployment (microservices, containerization) Quality Assurance: Oversee code reviews, conduct testing, and ensure adherence to best practices and coding standards Collaboration: Act as a liaison between the development team and other departments, including finance, accounting, technical management and engineering   Required Qualifications   US citizenship and ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI U.S. Government Security Clearance Experience: Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in Java development with at least 3 years in a cloud development role Technical Skills: Java: Extensive experience with core Java, Spring Framework (Spring Boot, Spring MVC, Spring Cloud), and Hibernate Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with at least one major cloud provider (AWS, Azure, or GCP) DevOps & Containers: Familiarity with containerization technologies like Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes Databases: Proficiency in SQL and experience with relational databases such as Oracle, PostgreSQL or MySQL Web Technologies: Strong understanding of RESTful APIs, microservices architecture, and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) Tools: Experience with Git, Maven/Gradle, and CI/CD pipelines (Jenkins, GitLab CI) AI/ML Framework Experience: Familiarity with Java-compatible AL/ML libraries and frameworks (i.e. Spring AI, DL4J, Weka, LangChain4j) Soft Skills: Analysis: Exceptional skills in requirements gathering and business analysis Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills Problem-Solving: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities  Location: Ypsilanti, MI   Remote candidates may also be considered   Ypsilanti is artistic, genuine, and original. A college town and city located on the Huron River in Washtenaw County. Ypsilanti is all about community and making families new to the area feel right at home. From educational opportunities and local museums for all ages, to accessible healthcare and transportation it‚Äôs a wonderful location. It‚Äôs well known for its historical museums, parks, and historic districts as well as home to Eastern Michigan University. The University of Michigan and Michigan State University also are great institutions! Ann Arbor is close by and has many things, including a bustling university town, culinary hotspot, and a tech hub with a walkable downtown that includes world-class arts and culture. Located in southeast Michigan's Lower Peninsula, Ann Arbor lies at the center of a greater collection of communities in Washtenaw County. With so many thriving communities nearby, Ann Arbor has become a cultural melting pot and urban oasis.  Remote  This can be a remote position that will primarily be supporting our Ypsilanti location based out of the Eastern Standard Time (ET) time zone.  What We Offer   Comprehensive medical/vision/dental insurance packages Company contributions to qualified HSA accounts 401k retirement plan with industry leading company contributions 3 weeks of vacation accrual per year plus time off for sick leave and unscheduled life events 13 paid holidays Upfront tuition assistance for approved degree programs Annual bonus program based on company and employee performance Company paid life insurance, AD&D, Short-Term and Long-Term disability insurance 4 weeks paid Parental Leave Employee assistance program (EAP)   EHS/Environmental Requirements  This job operates in a professional office environment. While performing the duties of this job, the employee routinely is required to use hands to keyboard, communicate, listen to, and interpret instructions and remain stationary for extended periods of the time. This would require the ability to move around the campus and occasionally move/lift items weighing up to 25 lbs. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of the job.  Applicants are invited to apply for a reasonable accommodation to perform the essential duties of the job. To apply, send a request to staffing@arka.org or contact 203-797-5000 and press 2 for Human Resources.  ITC & Security Clearance Requirements  This position requires the ability to obtain and maintain a TS/SCI U.S. Government Security Clearance.  This position also requires U.S. citizenship in support of contract requirements. Additionally, if you are a dual citizen (a citizen of the U.S. and another country), the Company must obtain approval for you to have access to the information required for this position. You will not be able to begin employment until such approval is obtained and this may take several months.  Visa Restrictions  No visa sponsorship is available for this position.  Pre-employment Screenings  Employment with any ARKA companies in the U.S. is contingent upon satisfactory completion of several pre-employment requirements to include a credit check, background check, and drug screen.

Job Title: Senior Software Engineer, eCommerce with verification
Description: About the job  About us: Stanley - Built for Life¬Æ since 1913.  Stanley 1913 has fueled the human experience since the iconic Stanley vacuum bottle revolutionized the way people enjoyed food and beverage. Today, our colorful and thoughtfully designed products including the popular QuencherTM series go beyond function, elevating everyday moments with style and empowering active lifestyles. We‚Äôre a community of creators, builders and inventors who believe in creating sustainable products for a better life and world that minimize our impact on the planet. Learn more at www.stanley1913.com.  Position Overview  We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Software Engineer to lead technical initiatives and deliver exceptional eCommerce experiences on Shopify Plus. You‚Äôll guide other developers, collaborate across teams, and ensure our storefronts are fast, accessible, and scalable. You will play a key role in enhancing customer experience, improving site performance, and implementing scalable solutions that support our business growth and customer engagement strategies.  What You'll Do   Lead the development and maintenance of Shopify Plus storefronts and related systems. Drive technical initiatives, coordinating the work of other developers, and collaborating with cross-functional stakeholders to ensure alignment and quality delivery. Build and maintain modern, accessible front-end experiences that meet WCAG and industry accessibility standards. Integrate third-party systems such as payment gateways, ERP, CRM, analytics tools, and shipping providers. Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and marketers to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions. Ensure optimal performance, speed, and scalability of the Shopify store. Implement A/B testing, personalization, and conversion optimization strategies to enhance the customer journey. Monitor and resolve production issues; work to improve incident management and deployment processes. Stay updated with Shopify platform updates, APIs, and eCommerce trends to drive innovation and technical excellence.   Who You Are   5+ years of professional software engineering experience with a strong focus on eCommerce. 3+ years of hands-on experience with Shopify, including Shopify Plus. Experience leading technical projects or small development teams through planning, execution, and delivery. Experience with headless commerce architectures (e.g., Hydrogen, Next.js, or custom storefronts). Strong expertise in Liquid and Shopify theme development. Skilled in modern front-end frameworks (e.g., React, Vue) and responsive, accessible design practices. Experience with backend technologies such as Node.js or Python. Experience with Azure or other cloud platforms. Proficiency with Git, branching strategies, and CI/CD pipelines. Excellent problem-solving, debugging, and analytical skills. Strong communication and collaboration abilities, including mentoring peers and reviewing code. Knowledge of SEO optimization techniques for eCommerce. Experience integrating with ERP systems (e.g., NetSuite, SAP) or other enterprise tools.   Stanley is committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. Stanley is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please reach out to recruiting@stanley1913.com.  Stanley is a total rewards company, which includes rewards beyond base salary. At Stanley, full-time employees are eligible for an annual bonus, based on company and individual results. In addition, we offer a variety of employee benefits, personalized time off, 14-Paid holidays, dental, vision, 401(k), and much more.  The base pay range for this position is for a successful candidate within the state listed. The successful candidate‚Äôs actual pay will be based on multiple factors such as work location, job-related knowledge, skills, qualifications, and experience.  Salary Range  $150,000‚Äî$170,000 USD  About our parent company: Morgan Street Holdings   Stanley 1913 is part of Morgan Street Holdings (formerly HAVI), a privately owned enterprise with a diverse portfolio of operating companies. These include HAVI Supply Chain, tms, Stanley 1913, and Continental, which provide best-in-class sourcing and supply chain capabilities, brand-defining marketing and promotion services, innovative consumer products, and dining and refreshment food solutions. Morgan Street Holdings employs over 10,000 people and serves 300+ customers across the globe.  Morgan Street Holdings supports Stanley 1913 with competitive pay and benefits, along with exposure to diverse industries and professional networking and development opportunities.

About the job  Description   American Express - Global Commercial Services - Shared Services Engineering  Team: Commercial Data Exchange  Role: Backend Software Engineer  Location: 200 Vesey Street, New York NY (3 days a week onsite)   This is a long term contract to hire position, looking for someone skilled in Kotlin, Microservices, C# or Java, REST APIS and Kafka    Group   In Global Commercial Services Technology (GCST), we develop software products and platforms across Small Business, Mid and Large Market and Global Commercial Clients. Our goals center around furthering the company's priorities of building on our strong position in commercial payments, whilst making American Express an essential part of our B2B customers‚Äô digital lives. We continuously strive to optimize the level of innovation, quality, and speed with which we deliver across many products and channels including Sales, Client and Individual Customer Acquisition, Digital Servicing, Commercial Lending, B2B Payment Products, Remittance Processing and Commercial Data. Together with multiple Product and Engineering teams outside of GCST, we work collectively to deliver enterprise capabilities to our B2B customers.  As a part of our tech team, we could work together to bring‚ÄØground-breaking‚ÄØand diverse ideas to life that power the digital systems, services, products and platforms that millions of customers around the world depend on. If you love to work with APIs, contribute to open source, or use the latest technologies, we‚Äôll support you with an open environment and learning culture to grow your career.   Team/ Project   The CDX team is ramping up to support a variety of new workloads such as a focus on re-writing current applications to Kotlin to better integrate across other Amex systems, as well as new feature builds including a commercial data exchange focused project supporting Real Time Authorizations (RTA) aimed at helping businesses make better business decisions with their data - particularly enabling 3rd party data integrations from card authorization data to external customers.  Day to day work will build off their microservice based foundational platform, building integrations with Kafka, building APIs to facilitate backend services, and expose APIs for the collection of certain data constructs such as authorizations.   What You'll Be Doing     Play a critical role in the development, design, and maintenance of American Express Commercial APIs  Architect large-scale distributed systems that ensuring continued success  Work across the engineering team to build new product features and services  Lead, mentor and learn with other developers in all aspects of planning, development and testing  Be a catalyst for driving best-in-class technology practices and patterns while staying engaged with the latest technology trends     What We're Looking For In You     Proactivity: Resourceful, has grit, and a positive ‚Äúcan do‚Äù attitude; acts without being told what to do  Flexibility/adaptability: Is cool with rapidly changing priorities and projects  Follow-through: Follows-through on items without being managed  Calm under pressure: Ability to navigate and lead the team through high-priority last minute requests and other high stress situations; Works well under high-pressure timelines  Analytical skills: Likes learning and learns quickly  Communication: Ability to speak clearly and with intent     Qualifications     Strong experience working with Kotlin as well as any of the following object-oriented backend languages: C#, Scala, Java  Knowledge of frameworks and tools in the respective language enabling effective and efficient development  Recent experience working with Kotlin at the enterprise level ‚Äì particularly in Kotlin re-writes is a plus.  Understanding and interest in architectural patterns for highly available, scalable, low-latency, asynchronous systems (for example, well-designed REST APIs, Microservices, high volume data pipelines, efficient algorithms)  Exposure to the benefits and challenges micro-services can bring  Experience working with Kafka or other streaming platforms  Experience with any cloud-based provider like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud  Strong experience with relational (PSQL) and non relational (redis, couchbase) databases  Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines  Experience working in agile environments with code reviews and automated testing     Top Skills Details   Kotlin  Microservices  C#/Java  Rest Api  CI/CD  Cloud  database  Kafka   Non-Technical    Additional Skills & Qualifications     Must be a self starter, growth oriented engineer who takes initiative in their work - "go-getter" mind set  Must be confident in their skills - can take requirements and run with them. This includes analyzing, pushing back on stakeholders, poking holes when needed.    Biggest challenge - finding people who are good at asking questions, good at finding the holes in requirements, can be receptive to feedback in the coding interview and adapt, and can articulate the decisions they are making when problem solving and why   Bonus Experience     Experience with Docker, Terraform, and Kubernetes  Experience with financial data, third-party integrations, and high throughput systems  Full-stack experience with React or Angular is a plus (current tech stack is heavier angular but going through re-write to React)     Pay And Benefits   The pay range for this position is $55.00 - $62.00/hr.  Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job  classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be  subject to specific elections, plan, or program terms. If eligible, the benefits   Available For This Temporary Role May Include The Following     Medical, dental & vision  Critical Illness, Accident, and Hospital  401(k) Retirement Plan ‚Äì Pre-tax and Roth post-tax contributions available  Life Insurance (Voluntary Life & AD&D for the employee and dependents)  Short and long-term disability  Health Spending Account (HSA)  Transportation benefits  Employee Assistance Program  Time Off/Leave (PTO, Vacation or Sick Leave)     Workplace Type   This is a hybrid position in New York,NY.   Application Deadline   This position is anticipated to close on Nov 5, 2025.  h4>About TEKsystems:  We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.  The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law. About the job  A Foundational Company  Rilla builds the world‚Äôs leading conversation intelligence software for offline commerce.  By recording, analyzing, and indexing conversations, our platform supplies unparalleled alpha to the critical, physical businesses that constitute the backbone of our economy.  Our purpose is to bring the technology of the 21st century‚Äôs most innovative companies to the rest of the economy.  As a side effect of this mission, we‚Äôve become one of the fastest growing companies in history. In numbers, that means 0‚Üí$40M in 3.5 years, growing 15% MoM, Net Revenue Retention above 170%, an NPS higher than the iPhone‚Äôs, and profitability.  The Role  Forward Deployed Engineers (FDEs) work directly with customers to quickly understand their greatest problems and design and implement solutions integrating their data with Rilla's conversational intelligence. You‚Äôll apply your problem solving ability, creativity, and technical skills to help organizations use their data to drive a real impact in the world. You‚Äôll have the opportunity to gain rare insight into and contribute to the most critical industries of the offline world.  The role is strikingly similar to those of a startup CTO: you‚Äôll work in small teams, often solo, and own end-to-end execution of high stakes projects. A day might span discussing data models and workflows with customer executives , wrangling massive-scale data, hacking an integration or full-stack feature, and bringing insights back to the rest of the team.  You will be on the forefront of extending Rilla‚Äôs existing footprint and strategy into new markets and problem spaces.  Do you aspire to be a founder or a leader in applying AI to the physical world? We believe Rilla is the best place ‚Äî with the best peers ‚Äî to learn how.  Technologies We Use   Different backend languages, including Typescript and Python Open-source technologies like Node.js, Turborepo, Lodash, and Zod Industry-standard build tooling, including GitHub Actions, Terraform, and Spacelift   What We Value   An infinite learner. Someone who is relentless in their curiosity. A customer obsessive. Someone who deeply care about delighting customers and solving real pains, not vanity metrics. A winning attitude. You thrive with extreme accountability, learning as a team, and both giving and receiving rapid feedback. Extreme empathy. Our customers are not tech companies. They live and work in the real world. Empathy is critical to arriving at correct solutions. Unafraid of failure. You take risks. You see failure as an opportunity to learn, grow, and be better the next time. In a weird way, you trick your brain into being excited when you fail, because it means you got a new opportunity to learn more.   What We Require   Strong coding skills with demonstrated proficiency in programming languages, such as Javascript, C++, Python, Rust, or similar languages. Familiarity with storage and data processing systems, cloud infrastructure, and other technical tools. Strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to iterate quickly with teammates, incorporating feedback and holding a high bar for quality. Ability and interest to travel up to 50%, as needed to client sites.   Don‚Äôt Work Here  Please Don't Join If You're Not Excited About   Building an AI product for an industry untouched by modern software Constantly talking to and visiting customers in the field Working ~70 hrs/week in person and in the field with some of the most ambitious people in NYC Attempting to build a generational company, and the intensity required to do so   Compensation  The estimated salary range for this position is $170,000 - $300,000/year.  Successful candidates with competing offers will receive matching and competitive offers.  Total compensation for this position may also include Incentive Stock Options, sign-on bonus, and other potential future incentives. This estimate excludes the value of any potential sign-on bonus; the value of any benefits offered; and the potential future value of any long-term incentives.  Our benefits aim to empower Rilla employees in removing roadblocks to achieving their life‚Äôs work. The list below details our available benefits and some of the perks that can be enjoyed as an employee of Rilla.  Benefits   Medical, dental, and vision insurance Clear + TSA pre-check Breakfast, lunch, dinner, and supplementary food and drink ‚Äî 6x a week Gym membership Commuter benefits Relocation assistance Take what you need paid time off, not accrual based $1,000 stipend for learning and personal growth Tech equipment

Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer/Software Engineer with verification
Description: About the job  Who we are  At PrognomiQ, we aim to develop and commercialize transformative tests for early detection and treatment of cancer and other complex diseases. To accomplish this, we are leveraging leading proteomics technology, including the Proteograph product suite from Seer Bio, in combination with other multi-omics assays to develop unprecedented molecular views of health and disease. We are a team of experienced and accomplished scientists supported by a group of leading investors in healthcare and technology.  Would you like to be at the leading edge of molecular data generation and analyses that changes how cancer and other complex diseases are detected and treated? Or are you looking to bring innovative and disruptive solutions to market? If you answer ‚Äúyes‚Äù to either of these questions, let us know by applying!     Description of role   We are seeking a highly skilled Software Engineer to lead the development and scaling of our cloud-based backend systems and Laboratory Information Management Systems (LIMS). The ideal candidate will play a critical role in driving the architecture, implementation, and deployment of core services supporting our diagnostics platform.     This is an on-site or hybrid work position with expectations of being on-site a few times a week.  Duties:  Communicate with the third-party vendor to develop and customize the LIMS system for products. Lead the design and development of backend services and APIs that power core product features. Work within cloud infrastructure environments, e.g., Amazon Web Services (AWS), and implement Infrastructure as Code using tools like Terraform. Make high-impact architectural decisions across backend systems with an emphasis on performance, scalability, and security. Drive engineering best practices, code quality, and architecture patterns across the team. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to streamline laboratory workflows through software automation.  Requirements:  B.S., M.S., or Ph.D. in Computer Science related technical field, or equivalent practical experience 5+ years of experience in the related field Strong programming skills in languages like Python, C++, JavaScript Proven experience designing and building scalable backend systems and APIs. Proven experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP, or Azure). Strong proficiency in web framework (e.g., Django, Flask etc.) and architectural design. Experience configuring and customizing LIMS platforms to support operational needs in lab settings. Proficiency with Infrastructure as Code (e.g., Terraform). Strong problem-solving skills and ability to work independently and collaboratively.  Preferred:  Understanding of regulatory and compliance frameworks such as CLIA, HIPAA, and 21 CFR Part 11. Experience working in a clinical, diagnostics, or biotech environment. Experience in LIMS integration and system integration for clinical applications or products Experience with continuous integration and deployment systems and tooling Experience with containerization and orchestration tools like Docker Experience developing and maintaining codebases and software libraries following industry best practices  Note:  Salary range varies based on demonstrated experience.     Equal Opportunity Employment  PrognomiQ is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other characteristic protected by law. This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship.

About the job  HYBRID ONISTE IN BEAVERTON, OR!  MUST HAVE QUALTRICS EXP     We‚Äôre seeking a skilled and experienced Software Engineer who specializes in Qualtrics. This role will be part of a high-visibility, high-impact initiative to optimize and expand our Qualtrics environment.  You‚Äôll play a key role in designing, developing, and maintaining scalable solutions that enhance user experience, streamline data collection, and improve reporting accuracy. The ideal candidate has a strong background in Qualtrics architecture, API integrations, and automation‚Äîplus a passion for creating efficient, user-friendly tools that empower teams to make data-driven decisions.  What we‚Äôre looking for:  3+ years of hands-on Qualtrics engineering or development experience Strong understanding of survey logic, workflows, APIs, and automation Experience with data visualization and analytics tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) Background in software engineering (JavaScript, Python, or similar) Ability to partner cross-functionally with researchers, analysts, and product teams

Job Title: Software Engineer, Information Technology Support with verification
Description: About the job  Company Description  Dropbox isn‚Äôt just a workplace‚Äîit‚Äôs a living lab for more enlightened ways of working. We're a global community of bold visionaries and resourceful doers who are shaping the future of Dropbox‚Äîand with it the future of work. Our Virtual First model combines the autonomy of a distributed workplace with the power of human connection, making space for both meaningful work and meaningful relationships. With our start-up mindset and enterprise-level opportunities, you can be who you are and grow into who you‚Äôre meant to be. Here, you can own your impact to make work more intuitive, joyful, and human‚Äîfor you as a Dropboxer and for hundreds of millions of people worldwide. If you're ready to push boundaries‚Äîand yourself‚Äî Dropbox is ready for you.  Team Description  The Dropbox Engineering Team builds the technology that creates more enlightened ways of working for hundreds of millions of people. Every day, our platforms‚Äîincluding Dropbox Dash, Dropbox Sign, and our core sync engine‚Äîhandle over a billion files for users worldwide, creating engineering challenges as great as the opportunity for impact. Our software engineering team uses a range of technologies to solve interesting problems, including Python, React, Node.js, JavaScript, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, and Android development. We think like a startup but build for an enterprise, exploring new possibilities that transform how people work. If you're excited about turning complex technical challenges into intuitive solutions at scale, join our Engineering team. Areas of work include Machine Learning Engineers, Infrastructure Engineer, Product SWE Frontend and Backend, Mobile Software Engineers (iOS and Android), Engineering Manager, Data Engineer, Software Development Engineer in Test, Security Engineering, Site Reliability Engineer, Technical Program Managers, Network Engineer, Datacenter Engineer, Technical Supply Chain Manager and more.  Role Description  As a Software Engineer on Dropbox‚Äôs Information Technology Systems team, you will play a key role in designing, building, and scaling foundational backend systems that support critical engineering initiatives.  You‚Äôll apply strong engineering fundamentals and modern software development lifecycle (SDLC) practices to drive execution, reduce technical debt, and accelerate project delivery. This role offers the opportunity to deepen your systems expertise while collaborating with seasoned engineers across Dropbox to solve complex, high-impact challenges.  Our Engineering Career Framework is viewable by anyone outside the company and describes what‚Äôs expected for our engineers at each of our career levels. Check out our blog post on this topic and more here.  Responsibilities   Design, build, and maintain engineering solutions that drive innovation across Infrastructure and broader Dropbox teams Apply SDLC principles to deliver secure, scalable, and reliable systems from design through deployment Participate in code reviews and proactively address technical debt to improve long-term maintainability and velocity Collaborate with engineers, architects, TPMs, and cross-functional partners to define requirements and deliver on strategic initiatives Partner with senior and staff engineers to implement modern standards and best practices across critical systems   On-call work may be necessary occasionally to help address bugs, outages, or other operational issues, with the goal of maintaining a stable and high-quality experience for our customers.  Requirements   5+ years of professional software engineering experience with a proven track record of delivering high-quality, production-ready systems Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field, or equivalent practical experience Strong expertise in backend development, with a focus on building scalable, reliable, and maintainable architectures Demonstrated success in developing and shipping large-scale applications or distributed systems, preferably in cloud-native environments Familiarity with modern infrastructure practices, including containers, orchestration, and observability   Preferred Qualifications   Proficiency in one or more modern programming languages, such as JavaScript/TypeScript, Java, Python, or Go Practical experience deploying and operating services in production on cloud platforms like AWS, GCP, or Azure   Compensation  Dropbox applies increased tax deductible costs to remuneration earned by certain qualifying employees (to the extent an employee will be involved in the creation of the software as an ‚Äúauthor‚Äù) for the transfer of copyrights, in accordance with the relevant provisions of the Personal Income Tax Act.  Poland Pay Range  256 700 z≈Ç‚Äî347 300 z≈Ç PLN  The range listed above is the expected annual salary/OTE (On-Target Earnings) for this role, subject to change.  Please note, OTE are for sales roles only.  Salary/OTE is just one component of Dropbox‚Äôs total rewards package. All regular employees are also eligible for the corporate bonus program or a sales incentive (target included in OTE) as well as stock in the form of Restricted Stock Units (RSUs).  Dropbox is a Virtual First company and is open to hiring candidates in all authorized locations.  Benefits  Dropbox is committed to investing in the holistic health and wellbeing of all Dropboxers and their families. Our benefits and perks programs include, but are not limited to:   Flexible PTO/Paid Time Off, paid holidays, Volunteer Time Off, and more, allowing you time to unplug, unwind, and refresh Perks Allowance to be used on what matters most to you, whether that‚Äôs wellness, learning and development, food and groceries, and much more Mental health and wellness benefits Monthly Internet Allowance Intern Social Stipend Annual Emerging Talent Summit, travel and hotel accommodations provided   Additional Benefits Details Are Available Upon Request.   Where group plans are not available, allowances may be provided Benefit, amount, and type are dependent on geographical location, based upon applicable law or company policy   Dropbox supports responsible use of AI for preparation, but misrepresentation of skills or experience is not permitted. See our AI philosophy.  Dropbox is an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to make sure all people feel supported and connected at work. A big part of that effort is our support for members and allies of internal groups like Asians at Dropbox, BlackDropboxers, enABLE, TODOS (Latinx), Pridebox (LGBTQ), Vets at Dropbox, and Women at Dropbox.

Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer II - StreamingTV with verification
Description: About the job  Sr. Software Engineer II - StreamingTV  Position Overview  Join DoubleVerify‚Äôs cross-functional Streaming TV team and help build solutions that enable advertisers to reach audiences across leading streaming platforms. In this role, you‚Äôll design and deliver scalable backend services and data-intensive applications that power our Streaming TV product suite. We're a technology-driven company tackling complex challenges with modern tools to build highly scalable systems. Our team develops products used directly by clients and deeply integrated with the AdTech ecosystem.    What you will do:  Design and develop services that integrate with internal and external systems. Build data processing applications that handle and enrich billions of daily ad events. Review code, provide constructive feedback, and promote best practices. Collaborate in Agile teams to design, build, test, and support technical solutions. Continuously release features using automated infrastructure-as-code deployment tools. Investigate system issues, debug, and resolve production incidents.  Basic Qualifications  Collaborative, resourceful, and quality-driven. 7-10 years of professional software development experience. Proficient across the full development lifecycle: coding, reviews, source control, testing, and operations. Experience building microservices and RESTful APIs. Strong programming skills in Python or a similar language. Deep experience with both relational and non-relational databases (e.g., MySQL, MongoDB, Snowflake) Solid understanding of scalable, distributed system design principles.  Preferred Qualifications  Experience with cloud platforms like GCP, AWS, or Azure. Familiarity with Docker and Kubernetes. Experience with event streaming technologies such as Kafka. Understanding of ad serving technologies and industry standards. Effective use of AI tools to enhance development productivity.  This position is full-time and located in our New York City headquarters offices offering a hybrid work model from office and remote.   The successful candidate‚Äôs starting salary will be determined based on a number of non-discriminating factors, including qualifications for the role, level, skills, experience, location, and balancing internal equity relative to peers at DV. The estimated salary range for this role based on the qualifications set forth in the job description is between $107,000- $213,000. This role will also be eligible for bonus/commission (as applicable), equity, and benefits. The range above is for the expectations as laid out in the job description; however, we are often open to a wide variety of profiles, and recognize that the person we hire may be more or less experienced than this job description as posted.  Not-so-fun fact: Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of job criteria, women and other marginalized groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you think you have what it takes but you‚Äôre not sure that you check every box, apply anyway!

About the job  Role Description  This is a newly-created position. In this role, you will report to two (2) senior tax accountants overseeing Corporate Taxation and Individual Taxation departments. We are looking for a diligent Tax Accountant to assist in preparing business and individual tax returns. Your responsibilities will additionally include managing client write-up work, assisting with sales tax calculations and other governmental filings. The position requires a detail-oriented individual with strong analytical skills and an in-depth understanding of tax laws and regulations. You will collaborate with clients to gather necessary financial information, identify tax-saving opportunities, and ensure compliance with all tax requirements. The ideal candidate will have excellent communication skills to explain complex tax issues to clients and team members. The successful candidate must have a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field and preferably hold a CPA license. A minimum of 2 years of experience in tax accounting is preferred, with a focus on 1120, 1120S, 1065 and 1040 individual tax returns. Proficiency in tax preparation software such as Intuit Lacerte and Thomson Reuters Ultra Tax would be ideal. Microsoft Office with advanced skills in Excel is essential. Knowledge of tax research tools provided by the firm's subscriptions for tax planning strategies would be available to the candidate. The ability to work independently and as part of a team is crucial for this role.   If you have a passion for tax accounting and a commitment to delivering high-quality service to clients, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

About the job  Brief Description     Job Title: Java Software Engineer  Position Type: Full-Time W2, Salary  Pay: $83,200 - $124,800/year  Location: On-Site, at one of their offices In Columbus, OH or Wilmington, DE  Years of Experience Required: 3  Hiring Timeline: Immediate  Company: The name of our partner organization will be disclosed during the interview process. We are unable to consider candidates for this role who have a current or future work sponsorship need (this includes those holding extended OPT Visas).     Position Summary  As an Experienced Java Software Engineer, you serve as a member of an agile team to design and deliver trusted market-leading technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. Depending on the team that you join, you could be developing mobile features that give our company partner's customers and clients more control over how they bank, strategizing on how big data can make their trading systems quicker, creating the next innovation in payments for merchants, or supporting the integration of their private and public cloud platforms.     Job Responsibilities  Participates in, design and develop scalable and resilient systems using Java to contribute to continual, iterative improvements for product teams Executes software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting Creates secure and high-quality production code and maintains algorithms that run synchronously with appropriate systems Produces or contributes to architecture and design artifacts for applications while ensuring design constraints are met by software code development Gathers, analyzes, synthesizes, and develops visualizations and reporting from large, diverse data sets in service of continuous improvement of software applications and systems Identifies hidden problems and patterns in data and uses these insights to drive improvements to coding hygiene and system architecture Contributes to software engineering communities of practice and events that explore new and emerging technologies Adds to team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect     Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills  Hands-on practical experience in system design, application development, testing and operational stability Proficient in coding in Java languages Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages Overall knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle Understanding of agile methodologies such as CI/CD, Application Resiliency, and Security Knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, mobile, etc.)     Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills  Familiarity with modern front-end technologies Exposure to cloud technologies, preferably AWS Exposure to REST based API design Experience with any of these technologies: Cassandra, Kafka, Terraform, Spring Boot, JMeter, LoadRunner, Dynatrace

About the job  üè∑Ô∏è Title: Software Engineer  üë´ Department: Engineering  üí∞ Salary: ¬£60,000 - ¬£80,000  üéÅ Benefits & Culture: See here  üìà Equity: A very generous EMI share offering  üå¥ Holiday: 26 days + bank holidays  üíó Mission: Elevate later life for everybody and build the care sector of the future  üíª Office Policy: Hybrid, Tuesdays and Thursdays in the office  üåç Office Location: London Bridge, London, UK  üîç The Opportunity:  The care sector is being transformed by technology, and we're looking for a Software Engineer to build a key part of this transformation. You'll drive the implementation of features for Found OS, our next-generation SaaS platform that's revolutionising care home management. You'll be working on the system that helps care providers manage enquiries, track occupancy, handle billing, and deliver better care to residents across the UK.  This is a hands-on role where you'll contribute to technical excellence while shipping fast. You'll work across our full stack (TypeScript, Node.js, React, Kubernetes), and experiment extensively with AI. We're looking for someone who embodies "outcomes over output" - someone who cares deeply about solving real problems for care providers, not just writing code.  üíª What does this role involve?   Building high-impact features for FoundOS, collaborating closely with your cross functional team Writing clean, well-tested code that ships daily - we optimise for sustainable throughput and move fast.  Collaborating with Product and Design to contribute to feature decisions based on care provider needs and business outcomes.  Experimenting with AI tools and integrations to enhance both care provider workflows and internal productivity.  Contributing to our platform evolution and improving developer experience.  Contributing to our engineering culture of continuous improvement.    üí™ What problems will you be solving?   Revolutionising care management with AI - You'll integrate AI to automate mundane tasks, provide intelligent transcriptions and offer predictive analysis, freeing up care providers to focus on what matters most - resident care.  Building the operational backbone of care homes - you'll develop the core FoundOS platform, building robust modules for enquiry tracking, resident occupancy, and billing. This work creates the essential tools care homes depend on daily to run their business efficiently and deliver excellent care.  Connecting the fragmented care ecosystem - You'll create seamless integrations with crucial accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage) and care planning systems. Your work will also feed FoundOS data into our marketplace, providing unique insights that help families find the right care for their loved ones.  Informing strategic decisions with data - You'll build comprehensive reporting and analytics dashboards that give care home operators the insights they need to optimise their operations and improve resident outcomes.    üëÄ We think you‚Äôll be a great fit if‚Ä¶   You have 1-4 years of hands-on software engineering experience with strong TypeScript skills and full-stack development across modern web technologies.  You're product-minded. You think about user outcomes, not just technical solutions. You can translate business requirements into elegant technical solutions.  You write code that others love to work with - clean, tested, and maintainable. You believe in continuous improvement and leave code cleaner than you found it.  You're obsessed with AI and actively experiment with LLMs, coding assistants (Claude Code, Cursor, Windsurf, ‚Ä¶), and AI-driven productivity improvements. You understand both the potential and limitations of current AI tools.  You thrive with autonomy but love collaborating. You are a self-starter who can see tasks to completion while contributing meaningfully to team discussions and code reviews.  You ship fast and iterate. You prefer "good enough today" over "perfect next week" and optimise for learning speed over prediction accuracy.  You're genuinely curious about eldercare and motivated by our mission to transform how families find and access care.  You're eager to learn and stay current with technology trends, especially in AI and web development.    Sound like you but not quite 100%? Apply anyway - we're looking for potential and passion, not perfect CV match!üíî This role isn‚Äôt for you if‚Ä¶   Our mission to elevate later life care doesn‚Äôt resonate with you.  You prefer working in isolation rather than as part of a collaborative, fast-paced team.  You're uncomfortable with ambiguity or prefer detailed specifications over problem-solving from first principles.  You haven't embraced AI tools in your development workflow or aren't curious about AI's potential.  You prioritize perfect architecture over shipping working software to users.  You're looking for a role where you can specialise in a specific area (ex: pure backend or pure frontend)   üî¢ Lottie‚Äôs Interview Process   Screening interview led by Lottie‚Äôs Talent Acquisition Lead First round interview led by Hiring Manager Technical assessment interview with the Hiring Manager and one member of Lottie‚Äôs Senior Management Team Behavioural interview with Hiring Manager Final interview with Will Donnelly (Lottie‚Äôs Co-Founder & CEO)   ü§© Candidate Experience: All candidates will be informed of their application status.   Pre-Screen & First Interview: You'll receive an email notification, but no specific feedback will be provided at this stage.  Hiring Manager Interview: If you are unsuccessful after this interview, you will receive constructive feedback via email.  Case Study: If you are not successful after the case study, you'll receive constructive feedback via email and be offered a debrief call with our Talent Lead.  Final Interview: For final-stage candidates who are not offered the role, we will provide your feedback live via a phone call.    üöÄ Meet Lottie  Founded in London in July 2021, Lottie is a fast growth HealthTech start-up aiming to build the world‚Äôs first SaaS enabled marketplace for care and with a goal of allowing families to seamlessly book care online in a similar manner to reserving a holiday stay via Airbnb or Expedia.  Since launching in July 2021, Lottie has supported millions of care seekers find the right care for loved ones and has raised over ¬£25m from leading venture capital funds including Accel, General Catalyst and Kindred, as well as from well known technology entrepreneurs including Mike Hudack (ex-CPTO of Deliveroo & Monzo) and Tom Blomfield (ex-CEO of Monzo Bank). More recently, Lottie was the acclaimed winner of LinkedIn and Startup.co.uk Top Startup awards.  As of today, Lottie offers three core products and services, including:   Lottie (B2B2C Marketplace) - Free service that helps families find the UK‚Äôs best care homes and home care services.  Found by Lottie (B2B Vertical SaaS) - AI-native OS software supporting care providers to effectively manage their enquiries, occupancy and finances.  Seniorcare by Lottie (B2B Vertical SaaS) - Employee benefit helping companies deliver outstanding eldercare support to their employees.    ü§© Why Lottie?   Career Opportunity - A career-defining opportunity to help shape the future of our flagship marketplace and tackle complex challenges across the stack! Early Hire Benefits - Be an early hire at one of the UK‚Äôs fastest growing startups and benefit from fast career progression, as well as a generous stock options package.  Mission - Tech for good that aims to build the care industry of the future and to positively impact millions of peoples lives. Care is one of the final remaining large consumer industries that is yet to be disrupted and positively revolutionised by technology.  Investors - Series A backed startup having raised ¬£25m+ from tier 1 venture capital investors including Accel and General Catalyst.  Global Opportunity & Scalability - Be part of a company that is solving a real tangible problem that every family around the world faces at some point in their life.  People - Join a kind, talented and mission driven team that loves coming to work every day.  Culture - Excellent employee compensation/benefits, hybrid office policy and outstanding company culture with a 5/5 employee review score on Glassdoor.  Award Winning - Acclaimed winner of LinkedIn‚Äôs 2024 ‚ÄúTop Startups‚Äù and named ‚Äúthe UK‚Äôs number one startup for 2025‚Äù in Startup.co.uk 100 Index.    We want to create an inclusive environment that celebrates the diversity of our people whilst enabling them to do the best work of their careers. We are committed to ensuring that all our people processes are equitable. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to ethnicity, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, family or parental status, national origin, veteran, neurodiversity status or disability status.  If you require reasonable accommodations during the application or interview process, please let us know at Alice.Rooke@lottie.org  Compensation Range: ¬£60K - ¬£80K

Job Title: Sr. Full Stack Web Developer (REMOTE) - Next.JS, Node.JS, TypeScript
Description: About the job  CGS Business Solutions is committed to helping you, as an esteemed IT Professional, find the next right step in your career. We match professionals like you to rewarding consulting or full-time opportunities in your area of expertise. About CGS Business Solutions:  CGS specializes in IT business solutions, staffing and consulting services.
